reviews.name: omar
reviews.title: Perfect Diapers for Wiggly Toddlers
reviews.review:
These Pampers Cruisers 360 Size 5 diapers have been a total game-changer for my busy toddler. The pull-on design makes diaper changes so much faster, especially with a squirmy little one who doesn’t want to lie down. The stretchy waistband fits snugly without leaving marks, and it moves with my child, which is perfect for all the running, climbing, and wiggling.

They’re super absorbent and leak-proof — we’ve had zero blowouts or overnight leaks since switching to these. Plus, no tape tabs means my toddler can’t rip them off (a huge win!).

If your little one is on the move and regular diapers just aren’t cutting it, I highly recommend these. They feel like a mix between a diaper and training pants, and they work amazingly well.

reviews.name: NB
reviews.title: Soft, Absorbent, and Leak-Proof—The Best Diapers for My Grandbabies!
reviews.review:
I absolutely love Pampers Diapers—they are hands down the best diapers I’ve used! They’re incredibly soft and gentle on my baby’s skin, which is so important. The absorbency is fantastic, keeping my little one dry for hours without leaks or discomfort.

The cute patterns are a fun bonus, making diaper changes a little more enjoyable! I also appreciate that the diapers are stretchy, providing a snug fit that moves with my baby and prevents any gaps. And the best part? They’re leak-proof! I’ve never had a problem with leaks, even overnight.

The value for money is excellent. I feel like I’m getting top-quality diapers without breaking the bank. I trust Pampers for my baby’s needs and will continue to use them as my go-to choice.

reviews.name: pedro victor suriel
reviews.title: Reliable and Absorbent – Perfect for Active Toddlers! Review:
reviews.review:
I’ve been using Pampers Dry Diapers Size 4 for my baby and I’m very satisfied so far. They fit well, don’t leak, and keep my little one dry throughout the day and night. The material feels soft and gentle on the skin, and we haven’t had any issues with rashes or irritation.

What I really like is the absorbency — even after several hours, the diaper still feels dry to the touch. The fit is snug without being too tight, which is great now that my baby is more active and moving around a lot.

Overall, these diapers are reliable, comfortable, and worth the price. Highly recommend for parents looking for a dependable option.

reviews.name: Keicy Rafael Beltre Feliz
reviews.title: Reliable Day & Night Protection – Pampers Baby Dry Size 4 Diapers Review
reviews.review:
As a parent, finding a diaper that offers both comfort and reliability is crucial. The Pampers Baby Dry Diapers – Size 4 (186 Count) have been a consistent choice for us, providing peace of mind throughout the day and night.

Absorbency & Leak Protection:
These diapers feature Pampers' exclusive LockAway Channels, which effectively absorb wetness and lock it away, ensuring up to 12 hours of dryness. This feature has been particularly beneficial during overnight use, reducing the frequency of nighttime changes and helping our baby sleep more soundly.

Skin Protection:
The Dri-Weave Liner helps keep our baby's skin dry and healthy, while the diapers are hypoallergenic and free from parabens, latex, and elemental chlorine. This has been important for us, as our baby has sensitive skin and we've noticed fewer instances of irritation compared to other brands.

Fit & Comfort:
The stretchy sides provide a secure and comfortable fit, adapting to our baby's movements without causing discomfort. The diapers are also lightweight and thin, making them less bulky under clothing and more comfortable for our active baby.

Wetness Indicator:
The built-in wetness indicator is a convenient feature, changing color to signal when it's time for a change. This has been especially helpful for us, ensuring we don't miss the signs of a wet diaper.

Conclusion:
Overall, the Pampers Baby Dry Size 4 Diapers offer a combination of absorbency, skin protection, and comfort that meets our needs. The 186-count pack provides a convenient one-month supply, making it a cost-effective option for our family. If you're looking for a reliable diaper that keeps your baby dry and comfortable, we highly recommend giving these a try.

reviews.name: Iris Ramirez
reviews.title: Reliable and Comfortable Diapers!
reviews.review: Pampers Baby Dry Diapers in Size 6 are fantastic! They keep my baby dry throughout the night without any leaks. The fit is snug yet comfortable, and the material is soft on the skin. With 144 in a pack, they last a while, making them a great value. Highly recommend for parents looking for dependable diapers!

reviews.name: Star
reviews.title: Simple yet very useful
reviews.review: Im a FTM and have purchased these about 3 times already. No diaper rash and no blowouts, those are usually because the diaper is too small for the baby. Great price as well. Very happy. Yes they are thinner than swaddlers, but are more flexible and have never leaked.

reviews.name: Terra Meek
reviews.title: Game changer for us.
reviews.review:
These diapers were an absolute game changer for us. We tried Huggies and we had blow outs and skin irritation and way more diaper rashes. We tried luvs and they survived maybe one or two pees and then leaked so bad. We tried a bunch of different off brands purchased for us at our baby shower and he seemed to leak thru them, get more diaper rashes or he would get irritated skin around his thighs or belly. It was heartbreaking.
We’ve been using these for roughly 4 months or so and we won’t go back to anything else.
They have a cute design (our one year old will hold a diaper while being changed and take his little pointer finger and point to all the little Sesame Street character and such on them. He sleeps thru the night with them comfortably with minimal times of leakage and that’s only if he drank more that day or he fell asleep super super late and we forgot to change him right before.
Their design is cute and their size runs true to size.

reviews.name: Bowen
reviews.title: The only place to buy newborn size actually hypoallergenic!
reviews.review: I have 4 children with so many allergic reactions to every single diaper in the world even the swaddler version of pampers from the hospital. They literally started turning her skin raw on day 5. Granted huggies sensitive completely turned the whole touched area by the diaper lobster raw after 1 diapers. Luckily when I had my first daughter hospitals gave out these diapers instead of the new swaddlers sensitive ones like my last 2 kids. So I knew they worked from the beginning a long time ago. I hope this review helps another mom that feels like she is out of option's unfortunately they aren't sold in store at the newborn size anymore but im thankful they are sold on Amazon. I had been cutting size 1 with scissors for about 5 days while we looked all over town for the right size newborns for our fresh newborn . We found out after our hunt they don't stock newborn sizes anymore. Thank you pampers for such an amazing diaper . 4 kids later going strong with baby dry !

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Great product no diaper rash
reviews.review:
Pampers diapers are a game-changer for parents and caregivers. The quality and comfort they provide are unparalleled, making them a reliable choice for keeping your baby happy and healthy.

Key Highlights:

1. Excellent Skin Protection
One of the most notable features of Pampers diapers is their effectiveness in preventing diaper rash. The gentle, hypoallergenic materials are perfect for babies with sensitive skin, ensuring they stay irritation-free.
2. Superior Absorbency
Pampers diapers are designed to lock away wetness for extended periods, keeping your baby dry and comfortable. Whether it’s a daytime adventure or a full night’s sleep, these diapers can handle it all.
3. Softness and Comfort
The diapers are incredibly soft, both inside and out, which adds to your baby’s comfort. The flexible waistband and leg cuffs ensure a snug fit without being too tight, allowing freedom of movement.
4. Convenient Features
Pampers offers a wetness indicator on many of their products, making it easy to know when it’s time for a change. The diapers are also lightweight, making them an excellent choice for active little ones.

Overall, Pampers diapers are a fantastic choice, offering peace of mind to parents and comfort to babies. Highly recommended!

reviews.name: Amanda
reviews.title: Hands down our favorite
reviews.review:
Pampers Swaddlers are hands down one of the best diapers available for newborns and infants. From their soft, cloth-like feel to their excellent absorbency, these diapers truly stand out. The fit is snug yet comfortable, and the stretchy sides ensure they stay in place without being too tight.
The wetness indicator is a lifesaver for new parents, providing a clear signal when it's time for a change.
The absorbency is impressive, keeping my baby dry and comfortable for hours, even overnight. Plus, the diapers are gentle on sensitive skin, with no signs of irritation or redness.
Another great feature is how thin and lightweight they are, without sacrificing performance. They're easy to pack for trips and don't feel bulky under clothing. The light, fresh scent is also a nice touch-not overpowering but just enough to keep things smelling pleasant.
If there's one downside, it's that Pampers Swaddlers can be slightly more expensive compared to other brands. However, the quality and performance justify the cost, especially for parents looking for peace of mind.
Overall, Pampers Swaddlers are a reliable, high-quality choice for keeping your baby comfortable, dry, and happy. Highly recommended!

reviews.name: Diamond
reviews.title: Outstanding, top of the line diaper!
reviews.review:
We normally use Huggies Little Movers with our 3.5 year old (nothing against them, they're also great diapers) but recently decided to give Swaddlers a try, and will not be going back. This is a top-of-the-line diaper and excels in all ways.

We use a size 7 though could *probably* get away with a size 6, and use about 4-5 diapers a day on average (not including his overnight diaper) depending on how much he's had to drink and how often he poops -usually once a day, but could be as many as 3 times, especially if he doesn't go one day.

The first thing you notice about these diapers is how soft they are. I mean, they just feel like they would be comfortable on a child, and since they're in them practically 24/7, that's important. The diaper is mostly white, and the overall designs are more muted than a lot of other diapers, with "Shilo and Friends" -an elephant and duck - on the front and back. I personally wouldn't mind something bolder, I don't think my child cares or even notices. There is a wetness indicator that goes down the length of the diaper, front and back. Nice to have I suppose for a caregiver who maybe doesn't change a lot of diapers, but at this age and stage, it's easy to know and tell. Like all Pampers diapers, they are scented. I happen to love the gentle powder-like scent, but it's a turn-off to some who describe it as too strong, and of course, if your child is sensitive to that, you may want to avoid Pampers diapers.

Inside, the top sheet liner keeps his skin dry, even when he wets heavily -which is usually - and does a good job of keeping poop from sticking to his bottom. The "blowout barrier" in the back also helps contain any messes. In terms of absorbency, I'm pretty amazed at how much they can hold. Being a little older, he tends to stay drier for longer periods and then pee a larger amount at one time, but the diaper almost always holds it in, and leaks are rare.

The one thing I wish that Pampers did do was have wider tapes, like Huggies, at least on the larger sizes, where kids are more active. It hasn't been a problem, so I don't really have a reason for saying that, other than that it seems like it would help with fit, but it certainly won't keep me from buying or using them in the future.

However, for a well-established brand with consistent quality, these could still be worth a try if you’re okay with more frequent changes.

reviews.name: Luisa
reviews.title: Make sure to change often
reviews.review:
I tried going with a diper that is more organic, however based on the reviews of those diapers being non absorbant. I came back to Pampers.

What I like about Pampers is that they do not irrate the baby's skin. They have good elastic around the waist and they look great. They are also durable and worth the money. My favo are Pampers Swaddlers. However, I wanted to try these and with these particularly, I have had a few blowouts. Where my baby's po has come all the way up his back. I have also experienced that if the diper is too full when he pees, some of it has passed onto his clothes. This has happened at night 3x. My recommendation is that do not let the diper be full at all. When placing the baby to sleep, even if the diper seems dry or it can hold a lot more pee, change it. Also when baby pops make sure that your arm is putting pressure on their button, this way the poop won't also move up the diper being that there is no extra protective lining as there is on Pampers Swaddlers. I changed back to Swaddlers.

These diapers seem to be more flexible than pampers pure, so they are easier for us to put on and they fit around our baby’s legs better. They are extremely absorbent. They have all of the standard flaps, blowout barrier, color changing line and size indicators as pamper pure diapers. You can’t beat the price!

reviews.name: Shannon Largent
reviews.title: Better than comparable Huggies
reviews.review:
My wife and I are spreadsheet nerds. So we estimated our need for diapers up until about the 18 month mark. We bought a combination of Huggies and Pampers, whatever was cheaper for the size we were buying. We learned very quickly that although in the past, the Pampers were inferior to the Huggies, that role has since reversed. We will not buy Huggies for the foreseeable future.

The one gripe I have, is that this box is NOT a months supply. That is misleading. Do the Math. 12 Boxes of these, will NOT last you a year... those numbers add up to 5 diapers per day (we are using the size 5), and every 3rd day, you get a sixth diaper alloted. (Averaged out over the year). So, a new diaper at wake up, a new one at nap time, a new one at bed time, and that leaves only 2 diaper changes throughout the rest of the day.

Maybe its nitpicky, but I feel like this is false advertising, and it kind of annoys me.

reviews.name: Kay
reviews.title: Does The Job Pretty Well
reviews.review:
This is what I've bought my son for years now. They aren't perfect but when you have an active special needs child who refuses to potty train, you're not going to find perfect. You just take what you know works and stick with it.

These Pampers are the best I've found for my child in terms of durability and leak resistance. He rarely leaks through the night as long as he's changed right before bed. He doesn't get rashes from this brand, either. My one big issue? When they get wet, the liner of the diaper flakes off, leaving a linty mess all over my son that's not easy to clean off with a wipe because of being stuck to damp skin. But all in all, if you get your kiddo to hold still to change them frequently, these are currently the best I've found on the market.

After several leaks, I have decided not to use them at night. I will be using Costco brand diapers for the night use as they never leak but they are not as soft!
CON: They claim to have wetness indicator but they DO NOT HAVE THE WETNESS INDICATOR!!!

reviews.name: Lisa K
reviews.title: Smaller than store bought ones
reviews.review: These diapers are just okay. It is disappointing to see that they are smaller than the store bought ones. The diaper on the left in my photo is store bought (I’ve purchased from both Target and Walmart and they’ve been identical) and the one on the right is from here. Even though they are smaller they still get the job done and appear to have similar softness on the inside but the Amazon one is tougher on the outside. I do have to change the smaller one (the one from Amazon) more frequently. It definitely does not hold as much compared to the store bought one. Overall, just go get the store bought one. You’ll be happier in the long run.

reviews.name: Chelsea
reviews.title: Baby Dry v Swaddlers
reviews.review: I work in a hospital where we use both pampers baby dry and swaddlers. It is funny to read comments claiming the diapers are counterfeit. The baby dry pack I received are just the same as the ones we have in the hospital. Pampers even mentions that baby dry is not as soft as swaddlers. The biggest difference I noticed between the two types other than price is baby dry has more leak protection and absorbency than swaddlers. Most recently I bought swaddlers and I am definitely changing my daughters diaper more often than with baby dry (while still getting the same consumption of food). Swaddlers are definitely softer and have better designs but does not provide as much protection.

reviews.name: Madeline Perryman
reviews.title: Good bang for your buck!
reviews.review: These diapers are great for the newborn stage when they need so many changes! Never have had a blowout and contains all the things!

reviews.name: madi cissé
reviews.title: Perfect quantity for Twins
reviews.review: Good diapers, no irritation but it still overflows from time to time.

reviews.name: Toshiko Parran
reviews.title: They’re ok
reviews.review: My daughter still had a blowouts but for the most part they keep her dry

reviews.name: Barbara Brown
reviews.title: Great price
reviews.review: Liked it really well

reviews.name: A Jeffers
reviews.title: My favorite diapers
reviews.review: Great for overnight even. The one negative with ordering them is the box they come in is the shipping box. It gets filthy and then if you take them out, the size is not on the inner bags. Not sure how to remedy but thought worth a mention in case anyone reads these.

reviews.name: Angela Matthews
reviews.title: Almost perfect
reviews.review: These diapers kept my son dry all night however they fit bad. His thighs are on the thicker side and they don’t feel totally secure around that area.

reviews.name: Cassie
reviews.title: One of the better options
reviews.review: My son is a chunky 1 year old and we struggle with him leaking through on the top and in the thighs if he peed or pooped too much. I should note, I do change his diaper frequently, but felt like I was changing him more when he wore these diapers.

reviews.name: Brenda Bonilla
reviews.title: No leaks
reviews.review: Worked good as an overnight diaper. Only reason for 4 stars is that we dont prefer the smell. Just baby powder scent but i orefer non scented. Great fit and leak proof though !

reviews.name: Justin
reviews.title: Works too well
reviews.review: So this diaper is really good!! No leaks or smells. But that’s the thing. It’s so hard to tell if my baby pooped because the powder fresh smell is so strong!! So it works so well that it’s bad for me because then I sometimes fail to change him immediately after his poops. Hopefully no diaper rash!!

reviews.name: courtney carnevale
reviews.title: Good quality diaper
reviews.review: So I gave 4 stars instead of 5 because my little guy will pee out of these for his overnights. I would suggest a specific overnight diaper if you want it for sleeping especially if you have a boy that is a tummy sleeper. During the day these are great. The only thing is that compared to the pampers swaddlers they do not have the line that turns blue when wet, but they are a few $$$ less than the swaddlers so you just have to choose what is important to you. I started putting my little guy in size 4 when he was about 20-22 lbs.

reviews.name: Lillian
reviews.title: Fits smaller than pampers swaddlers
reviews.review: They keep the baby dry for several hours. No leaks so far. I didn’t realize that they’d fit more snuggly than Pampers Swaddlers (same size)

reviews.name: Adrian M
reviews.title: Theyre good for the price I think?
reviews.review:
Ive been using Huggies and got these because they option was cheaper and Im trying to budget…they are definitely cheaper material.
No leaking has occurred so its doing what it needs to, hopefully it keeps up this way because I am concerned it won’t…but hey maybe itll prove me wrong!

reviews.name: Kristy studstill
reviews.title: Quality and good price
reviews.review: Great leak protection & absorbency. Especially during the night, with limited or no diaper changes so not to rouse baby too much so they’re able to fall back asleep quickly after a feeding… I’ve never had a leak and urine is absorbed well into diaper away from baby’s skin. (Of course heavy application of diaper cream or ointment before bed keeps baby from developing rash.. for my baby).

reviews.name: Miss Priss
reviews.title: Not our favorite but does the job
reviews.review: These diapers are ok. We haven't had any rash issues. They are cheaper than the swaddlers. The negative is that when they are wet, they really sag which causes more leaks so diaper changes need to happen more often. The quality feels cheaper than the swaddlers as well. Not as soft.

reviews.name: Gadget-Guy
reviews.title: One Month Supply ?Maybe?
reviews.review:
No complaints from the user...

No complaints from the Mom.

It's hard to guess what a One Month Supply is... depends on the wearer.

We had some rash issues with Huggies.
Some scents, materials, etc. can cause skin irritations.
No complaints along those lines, so far.

That's not to say that they won't change their process to be more like Huggies.
Seems to be the way our luck goes.
If it works - fix it - until it doesn't.
Blame it all on COVID.

reviews.name: Peaches
reviews.title: The tape does not secure pampers at all “ Not a good quality “
reviews.review: I’ve purchased a lot of pampers in the past 2 1/2 years through Amazon Please note: these last bunches were not of good quality at all The urine smells are stronger than usual

reviews.name: Jen Ambrosio
reviews.title: Good Daytime Diaper.
reviews.review: I like using these diapers for my son because they are soft, but not too soft that the pee will just run right off of them. They are just right, and my son seems to think so too. I usually won't have him wear these at night though because when I have in the past they've leaked. So now I just use these during the day and other "night time" diapers at night. I like these so much more than Huggies because they don't leave any gel behind. When I used Huggies, every diaper change I was cleaning off a bunch of gel from his bum. But I've never had that issue with Pampers.

reviews.name: Roya
reviews.title: Luvs mixed with pampers
reviews.review: I bought a box of pampers size 6 and I found about 5 diapers from luvs brand size 5 mixed with the pampers..

reviews.name: Jack & Karyssa
reviews.title: Diaper Bash
reviews.review: Got these for a diaper bash, great value! Only thing I didn’t like was they shipped this exactly as is. It wasn’t inside another box. So they put the shipping label right onto the pampers box which wasn’t so appealing for a diaper bash 😑

reviews.name: courtney carnevale
reviews.title: Good quality diaper
reviews.review: So I gave 4 stars instead of 5 because my little guy will pee out of these for his overnights. I would suggest a specific overnight diaper if you want it for sleeping especially if you have a boy that is a tummy sleeper. During the day these are great. The only thing is that compared to the pampers swaddlers they do not have the line that turns blue when wet, but they are a few $$$ less than the swaddlers so you just have to choose what is important to you. I started putting my little guy in size 4 when he was about 20-22 lbs.

reviews.name: Adelina Kuzmina
reviews.title: Not soft
reviews.review: They hold the baby’s pee and poop well but not really soft to the skin at all. For the price you pay I wish the brand could have made some improvements towards a higher quality of material as you use it on gentle baby skin.

reviews.name: Booker T
reviews.title: Self explanatory
reviews.review: Self explanatory I’m

reviews.name: RNLG
reviews.title: No lo recomiendo
reviews.review: Le sale mucho olor a pipí y corren por lo chiquito .

reviews.name: Kindle Customer
reviews.title: Have a strong smell.
reviews.review:
They seem to work okay for overall use.
The only problem that I have with them is that they have a strong smell.And when my daughter he's in them, it becomes an awful odor that makes it smell like she's pooped.
Will not be purchasing again due to that.

reviews.name: HashtagHer
reviews.title: Can’t stand the SMELL - returned immediately
reviews.review:
The smell of these is so strong. I took the bags of diapers out of the box and placed them in the nursery and within minutes the whole room started to smell like that awful “baby powder” fragrance of the diapers. Didn’t even open any of the bags yet. Nobody in my household is sensitive to fragrance, thank goodness, but the last thing I need is for my house to smell like one big diaper. Highly advise against gifting these. Wish they were more upfront/clear in their advertising and box design that these diapers are not fragrance free.
Can’t say anything about absorbency or performance as I refuse to even try these diapers.
Now I have to figure out what to do with the boxes of size 2 and 3 that were gifted at my baby shower.
I’m sure these work just great for others, but the smell alone is enough to deter me. I’m a first time mom and have only used Huggies (until now) because that’s what they provided in the hospital and I liked them. Just figured I’d branch out and try another brand to see if I liked these better, and I’m clearly regretting that now.

reviews.name: Noelle H
reviews.title: Not my fav
reviews.review: These aren’t my favorite diapers. I prefer the pampers swaddles. These are cheaper made and not as soft. My son tends to get rashes when using these, but not the pampers swaddlers. I wouldn’t recommend these.

reviews.name: Zetta
reviews.title: Not so great
reviews.review:
I never thought I would be a diaper snob, but Pampers don't make the cut for us. My son is one month old and is in a size 1, and for the past few nights he has peed through his diapers every night. It's not through the waist, but through the leg holes, no matter how I try to adjust the diaper.
I switched him over to Huggies and haven't had any issues. I tried using the Pampers during the day, thinking that maybe that would work, but still had issues. I'm giving away all of his Pampers and sticking with Huggies.

reviews.name: Danny
reviews.title: Leak every night
reviews.review: Idk if my son just pees a lot or what, but just a few hours into the night every night these diapers are full and overflowing. To keep him dry I have to change these diapers twice every night which nore he or I are very excited about. It's fine during the day when I can change him whenever, but not at night. Trying a different kind next time

reviews.name: Madison Wood
reviews.title: Thin and cheap
reviews.review: These feel so thin and have a cheap feel to them. They aren’t the worst diapers but are definitely one of my least favorites. My baby had the most blow outs in these ones. They also are just a weird design like they just don’t fit quite right.

reviews.name: Lia
reviews.title: It leaks and irritation appears
reviews.review: After this diaper, after the first trip to the toilet, he is very wet, so much so that urine can even pass through, plus my child gets irritated.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Not super absorbent
reviews.review: Purchased these for a diaper to hold through the night. First night leakage, tried again in the day time, during 1.5hr nap, still leakage. Would not recommend this style, very thin. Some benefits - It is probably a good diaper for sensitive skin due to the dry style, however it’s not in any way leakproof. These are fine for day to day use, but not for long periods over night.

reviews.name: B Jones
reviews.title: NOT IN LOVE, but more like a like
reviews.review: I guess they don't make diapers like they use to. FINALLY had a grandson and couldn't wait to get pampers. All my kids, nieces, nephews grew up on Pampers. But the experience isn't love. Yes they are cute and all, but they are no way holding for hours and keeps from leaks. Nope we changing more and more, don't know. Maybe they just don't make them like they use to.

reviews.name: donovan
reviews.title: It is thinner than regular pampers
reviews.review: It is thinner than regular pampers. You need to change them more often. They are not leaking, but becoming full pretty fast. So you need to be careful. I wouldn't use it for a night time

reviews.name: Alice Roselin
reviews.title: Good
reviews.review: I used for my baby it’s very good

reviews.name: Aubree & Val
reviews.title: Not the best but okay
reviews.review: I love pampers brand, I typically get the swaddlers but needed something with overnight shipping and grabbed these. They are okay. They do not have the blow out barrier that other diapers have! That already is a reason I will keep buying the swaddlers instead of these. You can just tell the quality of these are just not quite the same as the other ones but for a pretty basic diaper this is okay.

reviews.name: conner
reviews.title: Please check the size n baby's weight before order
reviews.review: We bought this for our G'son who are visiting 1st time. He's NB only 6 wks. We bought instantly NB size but he's leaned and well grown, little over 10lbs. Other brand they use for NB was upto 12lbs, we instantly assume our G'son was ok with NB. But this brand NB is upto 10lbs.. Little tight n start to leaking and had happened a few blowouts. Material and Confort, are great but it's my mistake that didnt check this NB products is for under 10 lbs. Please check before order. Now we have 1 half unopened package left unused....

reviews.name: MJH
reviews.title: This Low Cost Diaper is Great for Pee, Not so Great For Newborn Poo
reviews.review:
For watery poops, these low cost diapers are terrible and paradoxically, for pee, they work great.

I bought these Pampers Baby Dry diapers for my daughter when she was a newborn. Normally, we buy the Pampers Pure, but I thought I'd try something different and, a little less pricey. Sometimes newborn's poos are very liquidy more so than pasty, and these diapers don't absorb it very well at all.

On diaper commercials, they spill a glass of water on a diaper, wait 15 minutes, set the baby down on a colored absorbent cloth, and look, no leaks! ... Right ... yeah, when my daughter poops in these diapers, and I feel it when I'm holding her, I don't wait 15 minutes, I run to the nearest changing table because, if I do wait even 5 minutes, it'll be running up her back and out the legs of one of these dipes. Having her in the car and hearing her shart with these on ... shudder ... it could cause an accident, that's how quickly I have to get to a public restroom. Every time I see a mom, with a baby in the backseat of her car, who looks like shes gonna cry, I wonder if it's because she's in this very predicament.

And YET, for pee they work great ... Why is that? They have a (visible) absorbent pad located mostly in the front, which works fantastically for my daughter; holy crap, can she pee a lot.

The indicator line is absolutely wonderful, and all of Pampers' diapers are equppied with them. I wish the indicator ran through front to back so you could see exactly what type of cleanup you're working with, but ... you know ...

These also have the velcro tech on the closure tabs, which make it so much easier for readjusting the diaper. All Pampers' diapers have these, too.

I love Pampers, and despite this not being a 5 star review, I like these diapers, I just dont think they're a good design for a newborn's diapers.

I'm giving them 3 stars because, all around, they're a good low cost diaper, but they lack absorbency at a baby's age when parents may need it most.

reviews.name: Kendra
reviews.title: Swaddlers
reviews.review: These are alright, I'm not the biggest fan of the baby dry ones. They just feel cheap to me. The design is not my favorite either but that's not a big deal. They fit my 4 month old well though. I'm just trying all the diapers to find my favorite for my little girl.

reviews.name: Cd
reviews.title: Cheap feel
reviews.review: I’ve been using pampers with our son for 3 months because of the quality and fit. These pampers do not feel as absorbent and seem tighter than other size 2 pampers we currently have. Not sure why the discrepancy, but most likely won’t purchase again.

reviews.name: Zachary S.
reviews.title: Dependable daytime diapers
reviews.review: Diapers were great until we needed to overnight them. They leaked for 4 nights in a row so we broke down and got Swaddlers. They were our daytime only diapers until we ran out. The price is great, but definable not “100%” leakproof.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Quality has gone down
reviews.review: Not liking this box. They seem thinner than before. More blowouts.

reviews.name: Janet
reviews.title: Good affordable diapers
reviews.review: I dislike that they are super thin, my bbys clothes gets wet . It’s like see through.. it gets saggy fast.. I buy size 1 and 6.. it’s not best brand but it’s good and affordable ..

reviews.name: Lizz
reviews.title: Not a fan
reviews.review: Bought these because our normal diapers were out of stock. They worked ok but really hated the scent. I didn’t realize they would be scented so that was a shock. They leaked a few times but that’s fairly normal for most diapers. They seemed to cause more diaper rashes than other diapers we use. Just not a fan of these, they aren’t like normal pampers at all imo

reviews.name: Amanda D. Daley
reviews.title: Won't stay fastened
reviews.review: Normally, I love Pampers. These diapers are terrible. They will not stay fastened. My child is constantly saying uh oh as they come lose. I'll stick with swaddlers.

reviews.name: Laura
reviews.title: Amazon Delivery
reviews.review: Product is fine, but driver used a wifi blocker which is highly illegal and will be reported to the FCC

reviews.name: Items were not received
reviews.title: Very reasonably priced
reviews.review: Bought these for my newborn son, I however thought they were swaddlers so it’s a really different fit

reviews.name: Montana
reviews.title: Caution they are Scented
reviews.review: No shape, do not reaslly fit, AND THEY ARE SCENTED, MORE CHEMICALS BABY DOES NOT NEED

reviews.name: Just awful doesn’t even work
reviews.title: This is the brand to go with
reviews.review: Love them they work amazing and came as described and on time.

reviews.name: Rachel Branch
reviews.title: Ggggg
reviews.review: Everything was okay

reviews.name: Michelle
reviews.title: Not my favorite but does the job
reviews.review: I wanted to try these since I typically use Pampers swaddlers. These didn’t seem as thick and it doesn’t have the “blowout barrier” like the swaddlers. The price is cheaper for a reason. I suffered through since I spent money and already opened them.

reviews.name: Kelly Fern
reviews.title: Better than others but not my fav
reviews.review: These are nice, and soft. They stay on well. However when it comes to poo, we’ve had a few blowouts in these dry ones. I prefer the swaddlers since my baby is more mobile.

reviews.name: Waqas Shah
reviews.title: Leakage in some pieces
reviews.review: Im using it from last 1.5 years this time i got defected product which is very unpleasant for me. My wife is so angry because of baby clothes got wet.

reviews.name: Mary Solance Rutor
reviews.title: Thin
reviews.review: For some reason this is kind of different compared to the pampers that I got from Sams club. I purchased this online in order for me to use the points that I had with Pampers rewards. I feel like its thiner and my sons diaper get full fast.

reviews.name: Jituri Amar Ashok
reviews.title: Bad bad bad
reviews.review: Didn't like the quality at all. Shifted back to Huggies.

reviews.name: Rozee
reviews.title: Strong scent
reviews.review:
The product itself works, baby stays dry.
What I don’t really care for is the strong scent. It doesn’t seem to me like diapers should be scented. I understand the concept, yeah pee can smell. But I think most parents don’t let their baby sit in a soiled diaper for a long time. Also I don’t care for the blue dye color on the inside of the diaper (no, not the indicator dye). One last thing I noticed was the diaper seems thin.

I have tried pampers swaddles and pure, and I think I like those better. I have also tried Huggies, which seem a little thicker too.

I think this pamper diaper is comparable to LUVS.
If you like LUVS you’ll like this one. I personally didn’t use the LUVS, because my baby had a sensitivity to a similar diaper.

reviews.name: Ashley
reviews.title: Good absorbancy but the clasps hurt my baby
reviews.review: Good absorbancy but the clasps hurt my baby. It leaves these red marks behind even when I align it perfectly of course it shifts soon after when he moves about. I normally by huugiez special delivery and mama bear as an alternative. Especially are so darn expensive. This brand of pampers is a bit cheaper so I was hoping I could switch, but if it's going to leave red marks on my baby's hips/sides then forget it. It's not worth it. Also in regard to mama bear-pampers absorb better than mama bear but mama bear does not absorb better. Mama Bear gets these gel balls after my baby has peed in the diaper. Gross and messy but they are cheaper and not worst so it's good alternative.

reviews.name: NAT
reviews.title: Not the best, not the worst.
reviews.review: Baby leaks all the time in these specific pampers. He’s fine with the other pampers we’ve used from Sam’s Club, but these are smaller, thinner, and not very absorbent. He wakes up soaking wet using these. I recommend Sizing up if you are buying these for cost. I presume they’d work better if sized up. Not good for chubby babies! Still better than the basic Huggies I’ve tried, but I prefer Kirkland brand or the more expensive pampers or Huggies over these.

reviews.name: Reggie
reviews.title: Not the best, not the worst
reviews.review:
I give it three stars because I don’t think it has the best absorption. It also doesn’t trap poo that comes up the back out of the back of the diaper. We’ve had a few blowouts with this brand.
Overall it’s not terrible, but it could be better

reviews.name: Bianca Romero Burnett
reviews.title: Tab doesn’t stick
reviews.review:
I tried these because I ran out of my other ones and it wasn’t going to be here on time. I didn’t like them. Maybe I got a dud because the tabs were not sticking. A couple of occasions his diaper fell off inside this clothes! The elasticity was good! Comfort seemed fine for him. Too bad the tabs didn’t stick.
I’m hoping to make another purchase in the future because my husband likes pampers to hide the smell in the trash lol I agree but I like our other ones for now.

reviews.name: Emma
reviews.title: Good for toddlers but probably not younger babies
reviews.review: I'm giving this 3 stars because I think the 12-hour dry claim is completely false but they are suitable for what I need. I have a toddler. He's potty training. He wears diapers to sleep and for long car rides. Wearing diapers in these situations does not adversely affect his potty training. During the day he's in regular underwear. I haven't needed pull-ups since my first child when I bought into the belief that they needed pull-ups to feel like a big kid and that wearing diapers at night would somehow hurt their progress. (I have 4 and my toddler boy is the youngest.) He usually doesn't pee until morning. I haven't had any problems with leaks or rashes with these but they do fill up pretty fast. I try to only buy pampers because I've never had any issues with their diapers. I would strongly recommend the brand to anyone. I would recommend these for toddlers who aren't going to be running around in wet diapers anyway. I would not recommend them for younger babies who pee a lot overnight but maybe the smaller sizes are more absorbent. I bought size the 4 pack of 186 diapers. These were 49.99 before taxes but 52.99 after. They shipped to Maryland. I never select the subscribe and save option. I ordered them on a Friday and got on Monday with 2-day shipping. They were shipped with USPS and the box appeared to be in good condition.

reviews.name: Tom
reviews.title: Much lower than my expectation
reviews.review: It smells very perfumey. And unfortunately it is not what I expected, this is my first time using it. It's very thin, and even though it's perfumed, it smells weird.

reviews.name: Marzy Fouladfar
reviews.title: Leaks a lot
reviews.review: I used 3 different brands for my baby and I used Pampers for its more affordable price but I had multiple times that it leaked. More than other brands I used like Huggies. So I changed to Costco Kirkland and it’s way better than Pampers. I had way less issue with that

reviews.name: Emily
reviews.title: Major leaking
reviews.review:
We have used pampers in the past and loved them but had switched to the Amazon Mama Bear brand. When I found a great deal on pampers + wipes, I jumped at it! But when we started using these on my 18 month old, the leakage protection is non-existent. He usually don't leak out the top or the sides, but urine will seep through the front panel of the diaper. Don't get me wrong, sometimes my kid pees like a racehorse and it's understandable that there's some leakage with that amount of urine. But it's almost daily, no matter if he pees twice or twenty times throughout the night. I've had to do quite a few extra loads of laundry since using this round of baby-dry diapers.

We've also had a few that busted at the seams without the diaper being too full & the gel got everywhere. Maybe it's just the baby-dry or this shipment but I won't be buying the baby-dry again.

That being said, I am still a big fan of the pampers swaddles & the wipes will forever be my favorite!

reviews.name: Melina
reviews.title: Quality is going down hill
reviews.review: These have been, for almost 3 years, the only diapers my two toddlers don’t leak all the way through. I am subscribed to a case every 2 weeks. The last three months, diapers have been consistently falling apart- tabs rip off or seams open when putting them on my boys, and they seem less moisture proof than before if there is more than a light pee through the front panel. My most recent shipment it’s like every other diaper. What is going on!?

reviews.name: Kene11sh
reviews.title: Pampers
reviews.review: Was not a fan of this specific one. It fits smallerthan the regular pampers brand. Couldn't return it b/c I opened & used it. Nut had to give away the rest.

reviews.name: Caitlyn
reviews.title: Blowouts
reviews.review: These baby dry diapers do not have the usual blow out guard in the back. My baby has pooped up his back multiple times since this isn’t present. They do not seem good for everyday use, just overnight.

reviews.name: Maricela
reviews.title: Resistencia
reviews.review: Siento que no tienen buen pegamento se despega fácilmente 🤷 😕 a causado uno que otro accidente si son absorbentes pero en lo de elasticidad no 😔 paso la prueba para mi espero y en la etapa 3 sean pas resistentes y más fuerte el pegamento mi bebé tiene 4 semanas patea micho el pegamento tiene que ser prioridad para que no se le mueva no suelo tardar en cambiar pañal para evitar rozaduras hace del baño 💩 o pipí al instante lo cambio

reviews.name: Tuesday
reviews.title: Scented but work fine
reviews.review: They should really say that these are scented like baby powder. They work well but I don’t want scented diapers.

reviews.name: Jen
reviews.title: Scent
reviews.review: These have a strong scent. It’s like they have deodorizer in them. My baby’s room now smells like them. I am not a fan for my newborn.

reviews.name: nvm
reviews.title: They’re decent, not the best. Buy another.
reviews.review: These are decent diapers for the price. they are on the more thinner side so I think that’s what makes them fill up rather fast and my baby tends to wake up with them more versus when he wears a thicker Kirkland diaper version. So these won’t work as “night time” diapers. The Velcro on the sides are not the strongest either. You might as well buy Member’s Mark diapers instead for this quality. At least you get more diapers (210) for less. Also, I hate how fragranced it is. Just me though. We were too lazy to go to the store so gave these a shot, probably won’t buy again.

reviews.name: PhyllisJean
reviews.title: Wanted the number 2 ‘s that I got before
reviews.review: I use it for serious bladder leaking

reviews.name: Ashley
reviews.title: Love
reviews.review: Love pampers my favorite diaper brand

reviews.name: Kelly Hess
reviews.title: They have changed sizing
reviews.review:
I have used Pampers baby dry for a long time now. They are my favorite diaper. I have bought from the store and Amazon and never noticed any difference in each… until this past time I ordered a couple of weeks ago.
First thing I noticed was the smell. It was awful and was giving me a headache. I pulled every diaper out of the packaging and let them air out which helped a lot. But then I used one to change my son and I noticed they fit him differently. To make sure, I got a diaper from a relative that was the same size and brand and they are smaller. So beware when ordering. I don’t know if I just got a bad batch of diapers or if this is how pampers is making them now.

reviews.name: Bug
reviews.title: Middle of the road quality but as expected
reviews.review: Better than Luvs but not much better. These are what I call the Luvs version of Pampers. They hold things in but I wouldn’t trust them for long. They expand super quick and just don’t wick the messes like a Pampers Swaddlers or Huggies Little Snugglers do but they are a great value option for the price which is what I was going for. I don’t feel like my baby feels comfortable in them for long after wet.

reviews.name: Pamela Chambers
reviews.title: It’s ok
reviews.review: Gave my baby diaper rash but all in all it’s not too bad. Depends on your child’s skin type

reviews.name: Heavenly
reviews.title: Poor quality
reviews.review: I prefer swaddlers during newborn stage, but usually switch to baby dry at 6 months or so, because of the price. I don't know if they changed something, but I continuously had issues with these diapers this go around (this is my 6th child). Every poop was a massive blow out, nearly 0 absorbency for poops. Every morning he would wake saturated, I even tried changing him during his midnight feed and even then he would still wake soaked (maybe 6hrs later). They feel cheap, and the tabs often tear when trying to fasten the diaper.

reviews.name: Catherine Floyd
reviews.title: What the heck???
reviews.review: I am a fan of Pampers, but I recently purchased a pack that does not have a "blow-out barrier." Every time my son poops, it goes straight up his back, ruining his outfit. EVERY TIME.

reviews.name: Di
reviews.title: Baby is growing fast!
reviews.review: These diapers hold a lot! At 6 months, baby sleeps through the night and wakes with a very saturated and heavy diaper. But she and her bedding are dry. We definitely get our moneys worth out of the overnight usage. The challenge to having a diver subscription is that baby grows so fast and there are so many diapers in one shipment, we’re ending up with a lot of extra that we can’t use. And we have to keep adjusting the shipment for correct sizing. Note: these are not packaged the same as when you buy them in a store so you can’t take them to a store to exchange for a bigger size.

reviews.name: Katie
reviews.title: Used to be great I thought
reviews.review: I used pampers with my 7 year old and I remember them being great. I purchased them for my 11 month old and they suck. They don't last all night. Blowouts happen almost daily. We go through these quick because we change every 2 hours or else we have blowouts. We went back to huggies and have no issues. Huggies seem more durable and better quality. Pampers were thinner and not as soft.

reviews.name: Carine Watson
reviews.title: Feels Cheap
reviews.review: I loved the quantity but I found that the adhesive was not sticking for my 2 almost 3 toddler. He would complain that they were falling down and he did complain about itchiness. I was highly disappointed but maybe it was just a bad batch and they fit really small compared to any other size 6

reviews.name: Lauren T
reviews.title: We do not like the material and fit of these
reviews.review: First time purchasing this kind and went back to the others. The material is almost itchy/kind of rough on baby's skin. Had shipped to Florida for vacation and was forced to use the box or waste money.

reviews.name: Jean
reviews.title: Everything is okay but it has a fragrance
reviews.review:
Prices are decent and the diapers are decent but it comes with a fragrance that I hated. Of course they do not take returns even though I did not open other two packages.
They need to make it clear and state that this diapers comes with a fragrance that people might hate.
Some might like it over the other smell but I hated!
JUST MAKE IT CLEAR!

reviews.name: Rahul Mootha
reviews.title: Leaks
reviews.review: Leaks several times

reviews.name: Hallie cook
reviews.title: Not the best absorbency
reviews.review: It’s a great price for how many diapers but my baby does not wake up in the middle of the night very often. so the first night of being in these it leaked out the side she was laying on after 3 hours. The absorbency isn’t the best for a child that don’t wake up often in the night.

reviews.name: Karean C.
reviews.title: Lots of leakage!!
reviews.review: When I gave birth in the hospital, they gave me a pack of pampers, I tried it and there were leakage for the most of times.. so I never really liked it~! I have been using the “H” brand since then! This time with this order was because my “H” brand was running out before my subscribers, so I didn’t want to get the big pack! And STILL.. with lots of disappointment! Most of times with leakage! And I had to clean the floor or the mattress almost every other day. This brand has no improvements at all!! So please do try “hug....” brand, the absorbency will never let you down~! After all.. the only thing I like about pampers, would probably be the cute design of diapers and good scents with it! Good thing with that it’s your house wouldn’t be stinky anymore~ but be aware you probably can’t find out after your baby poops

reviews.name: R.G_Capri
reviews.title: Good quality but its my secind baby and its gives a little allergy on the skin around it.
reviews.review: Good quality but its my secind baby and its gives a little allergy on the skin around it.

reviews.name: Amanda M.
reviews.title: Very thin
reviews.review: I’m used to the swaddlers with the blowout barrier &’ i’m aware these have neither now but also are super thin . I’ll try them out but unsure if i’ll buy again

reviews.name: Poison
reviews.title: Too small
reviews.review: Too small for my 7lb 8oz newborn baby, and hard to put on.

reviews.name: Ruthann Clark
reviews.title: Solves my problem
reviews.review: I used these for my 7-10 lb. poodle in her last years. Thin enough to cut hole for tail, unfortunately some of the absorbing material would come out. Not enough to make up for the expense of doggy diapers though. Quite frankly have no idea how they would work for a child.

reviews.name: Juan C.
reviews.title: Fasteners tapes doesn't work correctly
reviews.review: Overall, the fastener tapes on this baby's diaper do not seem to be working properly. The tapes are not aligning correctly with the tabs on the diaper, and are not staying fastened when applied. Additionally, the tapes seem to have lost their stickiness over time. This is a major issue and could be a problem during changing the baby, as the diaper may not be able to stay in place.

reviews.name: Kiata
reviews.title: Cheap
reviews.review: Cheap price = cheap quality so I can't complain but to change my baby diaper every hour

reviews.name: S.W.A.G.
reviews.title: Not an overnight diaper
reviews.review:
Pro: low cost. Prime deal
No fuzzy. My little guy gets bits of diaper fuzzy on his guy parts so no fuzzy pieces of diaper is awesome.
Good for daycares that change diapers ridiculously often.
No irritation to his sensitive skin.
Cons: they get heavy fast. They go from dry to droopy call cps diaper real fast.
No back elastic. Which contributes to the droopy factor. No back elastic limits the diapers ability to contain blow outs.

Overall, I would not purchase again but will finish the box.

reviews.name: Ameya
reviews.title: Should have trusted negative reviews
reviews.review:
There were many reviews which suggested, these diapers may be counterfeit (seriously? counterfeit in diapers now?); I should have trusted those.

The quality of these diapers when compared with Huggies is just terrible. We used huggies up until our little boy was 8 months and decided to try out pampers. Pampers just feels very cheap. I am not sure if its a pampers specialty or if its these diapers they sell on Amazon.

Brand new diapers were torn around the edges (picture attached). Now I don't want to be so picky about these small little holes, but when you open a brand new product, the least you expect is a flawless product. We canceled our subscription. Switching back to Huggies!

reviews.name: CeCe Tyshay
reviews.title: Prefer the Swaddlers
reviews.review:
This is my 2nd pack of Pampers. 1st time I bought swaddlers and I loved them. I just got these because more came in the pack but I think the swaddlers were better quality. The baby-dry feels and looks like more of a cheaper design and not the same level of softness.
The night I put swaddlers on overnight my baby slept so much better than any other diaper but the night I switched to baby-dry suddenly she kept waking up again although it says 12 hour protection. So not the worst diapers but in my experience I would say get the Pampers Swaddlers.

reviews.name: 🌸The Vu Family🌸
reviews.title: Back to Swaddlers for me
reviews.review:
It is definitely more absorbent than all other diapers I've used, but I don't like that it doesn't have a urine indicator strip. It dawned on me that I would never leave my baby in a soiled diaper for 12 hours; with the indicator strip diapers I could change his diaper every time he was wet, but now I might go a couple of hours without changing because I don't realize he's urinated and then I feel bad (I'm a new mom, so pretty much anything makes me feel bad).

Also he has had some leakage (stool & urine) if he's laying on his side (during feedings or just a quick nap next to mommy). I thought maybe I'm not using the diapers properly, but it's happened a couple of times when I've had seasoned moms change him.

I bought the 104 pack and diapers aren't cheap, so of course I'm going to use them up, but I'm going back to Pampers Swaddlers after this.

reviews.name: Daniela Solis
reviews.title: Not leak proof
reviews.review: When I saw these I thought wow 100% leak proof? No way sign me up! Well after a few nights of using them on my son, let me tell you, they're not leak proof. I can't tell you how many times I've had to wipe him down wash his bedding and clothes. I'm not a fan and I will not be buying these again. 100% leak proof? Don't believe it.

reviews.name: Heather T. Rohn
reviews.title: Not good for sensitive skin
reviews.review: We use Pampers Pure now, sometimes Swaddlers, but we cannot use the baby dry for our sensitive skinned girl. I believe it has something to do with the dyes in this version of their diapers that causes such an awful rash. Whatever is used to make the diapers blue is most likely causing the issue (per her ped). We like the pure bc we haven’t had a diaper rash since we switched to those, about 4 months ago and there isn’t much chemicals in those.

reviews.name: Cl716
reviews.title: Tabs won't stay on!
reviews.review: I normally use huggies, sometimes pampers swaddlers but these were significantly cheaper so I figured I try them but the closure tabs wouldn't stay on and my toddler kept losing his diaper! Otherwise the material was good and the seemed ok!!

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Tabs don’t stick well
reviews.review: Had been using Amazon brand and those work great. Decided to try these again and the tabs are shorter and don’t stick as well as the Amazon ones. I have two in diapers and the older one always complains these pop off.

reviews.name: G. Kim
reviews.title: A ok for baby.
reviews.review:
Softer, gentler than Swaddlers. If you've used the Pampers Swaddlers you'll notice that these diapers are missing the mesh fabric. Our baby did not do well with the mesh fabric. At just under 6 lbs, he swims in the swaddlers and the baby dry and the mesh fabric chafes at his delicate skin. So these were better for being such a small baby.

We do miss the wetness indicator but these puff up at wetness or soiling and are easier to tell when he's had an movement through clothes. I can feel for hardness as an indication through clothes better than the swaddlers. Which is nice when our baby is bundled under clothes that are hard to undo. The velcro closure isn't in the yellow and we do fumble for tabs when we're trying to finish closing our baby.

So although not a perfect diaper for the parents, our baby is comfortable and dry. Even at 5lbs 11oz and runny stool from breastfeeding he hasn't had a leak.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: I'm not sure if I got a bad batch but.......
reviews.review: These diapers suck. I am finding myself having to change him every two hours. I love pampers but maybe I have a bad batch or something. The price is good for the amount you get. I'm going through these really fast and that never happens.

reviews.name: Leah
reviews.title: Got older diapers
reviews.review: They rebranded awhile ago and I received the older ones. They fit but distinct differences in the thickness of diapers and waist height. Advertised as rebranded/updated diapers but not what is being delivered.

reviews.name: Michele Kramer
reviews.title: Diapers
reviews.review: the boxes that are used to drop items off must be COVERED with DUST, the packages are so dirty. I have to immediately Change my clothes because the outfit is RUINED until you can wash it!!

reviews.name: S. Yee
reviews.title: Thin and not leakproof like Swaddler.
reviews.review: I usually use the Swaddler for my 1 yo. I want to try a cheaper alternative (Baby Dry). This diaper is not as leakproof as Swaddler. A few times his diaper leaked a little in the morning. I’m switching back to Swaddler for him. They work fine for my 3 yo though. I bought the 2nd box 3 weeks after I bought the first one through S&S. They are the same size, size 5. I’m confused why the diapers from first box have the yellow/blue line detector for the pee and the ones from second box don’t have the line.

reviews.name: cheng
reviews.title: It leaks! Disappointed after switched from Huggies
reviews.review: We have been using Huggies' top of line for past 2 months, but decided to give this one a try since it says leak protection and is much cheaper than Huggies.. IT DID NOT WORK! First Time using it and it leaked on our 2 months old baby's back. See photo. Very disappointed.

reviews.name: Alicia
reviews.title: Wrong size, terrible quality
reviews.review: We use sizes 5&6 diapers currently for our two toddlers. We ordered the 6 and they were definitely not a size 6! Always use pampers but these were absolutely terrible quality and way too small. Back to target I go.don’t waste your money.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Sticky adhesive thing to hold diaper too poor quality
reviews.review: The sticky adhesive thing rip off almost for all diapers. I am concerned it fall apart one day and my baby will get wet while sleeping or while we are out traveling. Adhesive band seems to be of very poor quality

reviews.name: Lolita
reviews.title: 12hrs? No. Dry? No.
reviews.review: They absorb so well they feel DAMP. I got these specifically for night use. I can get 4 hrs out of them before they start leaking. Not much of a difference then a reg diaper. The only thing i like about them is when they get wet they dont get all big and bulgy like your baby is smuggling a brick in his britches. When these get wet it still looks like hes wearing a dry diaper, just slightly puffy. I would buy them again just for that reason.

reviews.name: Christopher Ramirez
reviews.title: This product is cap
reviews.review: Doesn't really hold up much 💀....talking about day and night

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: transit
reviews.review: product container was damaged, can still use diapers so not sending back, but just letting you know the box was damaged on arrival

reviews.name: Jessica Kelly
reviews.title: These are usually my go to diaper, but I got a bad batch.
reviews.review: Idk if they changed these diapers or I got a bad batch but the Velcro tabs are weak and the diapers keep falling off.

reviews.name: Faith Talley
reviews.title: If it wasn't for the strong perfume smell...
reviews.review: For the basic functions of the diaper i.e. absorbency, leak protection, the fit, this is a good product. But we just could not get past the very strong perfume smell. The diapers come in a box, wrapped in plastic inside the box and we could smell it before we opened the box. The smell persists for a long while, even after unwrapped. The perfume is so strong you'll smell it even when the baby is fully dressed. We stopped using them because of the smell and switched to a different brand.

reviews.name: 2020Momof3
reviews.title: PAMPERS SWADDLERS IS BETTER
reviews.review: We have used huggies and Pampers. Now that our son is in the largest diaper size there are Pampers is the best option for us as they are slightly bigger than huggies. When we used the Pampers swaddlers we didnt notice leaking or anything, but since we got the Pampers baby weve noticed that they pee seems to seep through when the diaper isnt full. His huggies would fill up quicker but they didnt seap through like these do. We even switched to Pampers overnights because they work great and are bigger than huggies

reviews.name: Dannielle C.
reviews.title: Good product but over priced on Amazon
reviews.review: As stated in the title it’s a good product, and original pampers. However, the size 4 for example which is $50 for 140 when for $41 I can get 190 at BJs. More product for less and I’m certainly not burning more than 1 gallon of gas driving there to get them. Somethings are worth getting on Amazon, if you are a penny pinching momma, diapers and wipes are not worth ordering on Amazon.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Great diapers but strong scent
reviews.review: These diapers are a great fit and leak proof, however, they have a very strong scent to them that irritates my baby's skin.

reviews.name: Kristen H.
reviews.title: Runs smaller than other size 1's
reviews.review: These are ok. I noticed they run smaller then other size 1 diapers. That was the only issue. They didn't give my son any rashes and didn't leak.

reviews.name: WestKarolina
reviews.title: Not for overnights
reviews.review: Great price but these are definitely daytime diapers. Leaks happen when wearing overnight. They are thin and therefore not as absorbent.

reviews.name: Samantha
reviews.title: Irritates baby skin, will stick with pamper swaddlers
reviews.review: This baby dry brand irritates my baby’s skin and leaves marks. Will not continue to purchase this kind. I prefer pamper swaddler

reviews.name: Ana Paula Lance
reviews.title: Runs small
reviews.review: It’s got a good price point but runs small and I’ve had some leaks. And before my baby was on solids, I’d have quite a lot of blowouts too.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: transit
reviews.review: product container was damaged, can still use diapers so not sending back, but just letting you know the box was damaged on arrival

reviews.name: Nelly
reviews.title: Not for babies who are chubby
reviews.review: These are like A&F acbut for toddlers. Not for chubby babies since they look like they're barely hanging on for dear life when your diaper gets full. Good to know, I forgot I hated these. They fill fast unless my babies pee alot. :/

reviews.name: Shakera Johnson
reviews.title: Urine smell
reviews.review: I have a new born and I noticed with these pampers specifically; I can smell her urine more which is unusual to me. And sometimes I see particles all around which also concerns me. Will not purchase again unfortunately. Besides there cute

reviews.name: Heather M
reviews.title: Leaks and Blowouts Galore!
reviews.review: Be aware of your baby's body type before purchasing - our kiddo is on the small size (10th percentile in weight *at best*) yet these diapers couldn't even hold in a #1 for her (and yes, we fluffed and made sure the inner liner was correctly adjusted). If the diaper got remotely heavy it would leak and/or fall off! Not a single poopy diaper was without blowout. We sized up, and had the same issues. Ultimately, we went TWO sizes above the recommendation for her weight, with the same issues! We *think* her torso was too long for this style, and despite how tight or loose we adjusted the velcro, the diaper just couldn't cut it. Switched to Swaddlers, very few blowouts or leaks.

reviews.name: JEMI
reviews.title: Favorite Tried-and-True Diaper of them all
reviews.review:
UPDATE April 2024: My oldest son is now 3.5 and I have a 2 year old and a 3 month old. Pampers, my long time go-to, the diaper I always went back to after trying others, is no longer my go to. They must have changed, because suddenly they’re average at best, at least their most economic “baby dry” style. The absorption is not as good as it was (I used to be able to use them as overnight diapers even!) and worse, the TABS. They don’t stay stuck anymore. My older two would come over to me to let me know their diaper was falling off. A couple times my daughter was running and thump, diaper completely fell off. Diapers were not too full, either.
At first, I thought it might be a bad box. Or, on occasion you see reviews on Amazon where reviewers think diapers might be “knock offs.” So I got another couple bags of Pampers from my local grocery store. Same deal. More leaks and tabs that just won’t stay attached. I no longer recommend these Pampers Baby Dry diapers. I change my 5 star rating down to a whopping 2 star.

Original review: Pampers are the most reliable diapers I've tried with my now 16 month old son, hands down.
I enjoy trying different varieties of diapers and even comparing the same diapers in different countries. My son was born in Italy and we moved to the US when he was 10 months old. In Italy we tried Pampers, Huggies, Amazon, and grocery store brand. In the US we've tried Pampers, Pampers Pure, Amazon, Sam's Club, Hello Bello, Dyper, and Honest.
For context, my son is a higher percentile (big), heavy-wetting baby. We had plenty of leaks when he was younger. Once we found that Pampers never leaked, we stuck with those, or kept them as overnight diapers if I couldn't find a good price on them. Now that we're in the US, I've found that Pampers are still the best. Interestingly enough, the Italian and American Pampers are slightly different. The protection and absorption are mostly the same, the main difference beyond the prints is how the American Pampers "fuzz" after they've been on for a bit. Not a big deal at all, but interests me to know why, and maybe there are more differences than meet the eye.
Yay for Pampers around the world!

reviews.name: Melissa
reviews.title: Thought why not
reviews.review: I’ve never felt compelled to write a diaper review but wish I would have had one before I bought these! To preface, I’m a mom of 2 (ages 2 and 1 month), I’ve been in diaper trenches for a bit now. As a value shopper, Target up&up is our go to. We were traveling and I figured it was easier to Prime some diapers so here we are at the Pampers Baby Dry. I’ve used Pampers Swaddlers, excellent review on those. These Pampers are quite awful. The fabric barely absorbs liquid, both of my kiddos are damp every time I change the diaper. We’ve had to run to the store to purchase more diaper cream in hopes of preventing diaper rash with these. Save your money, get the Swaddlers or another brand. Giving 2 ⭐️ as they haven’t leaked yet but I’ve been changing twice as much as I normally would.

reviews.name: M.K.V
reviews.title: Uncomfortable
reviews.review: Lightweight it is but uncomfortable on her skin. Hold moisture up to 5 hours at night then runs through. Just change diaper 4 hour at night or depending on how your baby go. Only concern is that the diaper is not for comfort.

reviews.name: frnch
reviews.title: These diapers have changed for the worst!
reviews.review:
**2 stars because I could use them during the day. But useless for overnight. Purchased the "improved" ones from both Amazon and Wal-Mart, thought maybe the first box from Amazon was a bad batch. If you don't wanna read my rant, look at review pictures and that's what happened to me. Pee diaper fluff everywhere each morning. Baby got diaper rash.

I've been using the Baby Dry diapers for over 2 years and definitely noticed the difference in their "new" diapers. I have a 2 ½ and a 1 year old and they both used to be able to sleep through the night with the old ones. I'm talking 12hrs straight because that's just how they sleep. Diaper would be FULL but intact by some magical diaper force. Like scary full. Sometimes they would poop. Yet, no leaks! And no rashes. Ordered these new ones and hahahaha...yeah. EVERY MORNING diaper fluff all over my 1yr old's legs and belly. My optimistic butt tried them for 6 days. Even woke him up for a diaper changes in the middle of the night a couple nights and still happened. Like MAAAAYBE 4-5 hours overnight then it has to be changed. Poor baby got a nasty rash because I kept giving them a try.
So I thought, maybe it's just a bad batch from Amazon. So I picked some up at Wal-Mart. Nope. Same problem. So now I'll be returning 3 boxes of diapers and might have to switch to Swaddlers or the Movers or just switch brand. But if you need them for just daytime wear, go for it. Just watch out for it exploding overnight.

reviews.name: Asiral
reviews.title: Nice structure but leaked
reviews.review: flexible and thin, however, they smelled like urine almost immediately and were also so thin they caused leaks. By far my least favorite diaper I’ve tried on my baby.

reviews.name: Lacy
reviews.title: Leak
reviews.review: Pampers swaddlers are great, but these ones say 100% leak proof and every single time I have had blowouts and had to change outfits and wet diapers leak diapers feel wet on the outside after very short time , probably the worst diapers I ever used now I have to go get more diapers even though I have a whole huge box of these. Plus they feel like a doggy pad very thin paper like.

reviews.name: Stephanie
reviews.title: leaky, bad velcro
reviews.review: leaky, bad velcro

reviews.name: Paulina Grillo
reviews.title: NOT leakproof
reviews.review: I bought these diapers for overnight use, and they leak every single night. So I’ve been using them during the day, they STILL leak, she can’t go more than 3 hours without a diaper change without leaking. I don’t know if my baby pees much more than other babies but for a diaper that says it’s leakproof, it’s very disappointing.

reviews.name: Cherrelle
reviews.title: Least favorite
reviews.review: The baby dry diapers are my least favorite of the brand. They fill pretty quickly with the least amount of liquid and leak. They are the thinnest of the pamper brand.

reviews.name: Jasmine
reviews.title: quality is not the same
reviews.review: i have used these diapers when my twins were babies and loved them. tried them out with my 7 month old due to her usual diapers taking too long to ship thinking they’d be fine. absolutely not. she can’t even make it halfway through the night without SOAKING the diaper and her clothes. she’s pooped within an hour of getting a fresh diaper and still leaked through the sides. she is well within the weight range of these diapers, they are just of cheap quality now. never had these issues with huggies and i would not purchase again.

reviews.name: Renaissance Woman
reviews.title: Definitely not leak proof
reviews.review: All pampers are not created equal. I bought these by mistake and my baby has had more blowouts over the past two weeks than in her previous 8 months alive. We're stuck with this pack for now but won't be buying again.

reviews.name: Juan Sanchez
reviews.title: Not a good buy for me
reviews.review: I'm writing this review because there wasn't any way to submit a complaint of on these diapers. This is second time buying Pampers since we used to buy Hughies but this time I bought baby dry diapers series I can say its worst diaper I've ever bought. About less than month ago had bought the Pamper Cruiser 360 they were one of the best I had ever put on my child. I decided to give a chance to baby dry diapers but have been nothing but bad they leak and don't conform with my child's waist or legs every time he crawls it falls. If someone can contact me, please do i really like my first time of buying Pampers but this time it was bad.

reviews.name: Alyx
reviews.title: These aren’t as great as swaddles
reviews.review: These fit my baby fine but they leaked constantly. They were easy to put on and get off. They looked comfortable but like I said they didn’t hold. They also smelled like pure baby powder (it was a very heavy smell, which I didn’t like because it was so strong). We switched to Swaddlers (they never leak and fit my baby better).

reviews.name: Teresha Ayala
reviews.title: Cheaper version of Pampers Swaddlers
reviews.review: I had my 7 mo. old grand baby overnight this past Sunday & Monday. My daughter only had a few disposable diapers left so I told her not to worry that I’d buy him some & they’d be delivered by the time I got the babe to my house. The next morning she says, “I hope those aren’t the diapers you ordered bc those give him blisters on his baby boy parts!?” I said, “Yeah, I ordered the Swaddlers”. She tells me to look at the box & freaked out bc the Baby-Dry are the 1’s that hurt him so bad. I felt horrible. Thankfully I had only used 1 on him. BUT, today I went to watch him while she went to class & I felt like the worst nana…my little lovey had a rash on his bum & a blister on his baby boy parts just from wearing that 1 diaper for just under an hour. Now I have a whole box of diapers that they told me to keep. I’ll donate them but I’m praying they don’t affect another baby the way they did my little lovey.😔

reviews.name: J
reviews.title: Not dry
reviews.review: Was using a different pampers diaper, one with elephants on them and those were good. These, not so much. My son pees through them all the time. Front of his onesies are usually wet and has even peed through them onto me while holding him.

reviews.name: stephanie providence
reviews.title: Diaper keeps leaving fabric residue on my newborn
reviews.review: I normally use Pampers as my diaper of choice. This is my first time ordering it on Amazon. However, the fabric inside the diaper just stays on him. I have to remove them every time I change his diaper. I would not purchase again.

reviews.name: FT Law Student
reviews.title: Not my favorite!
reviews.review:
I purchased this and I was DISAPPOINTED! The diapers are much more thinner than the pampers swaddle. I could easily smell my baby’s urine - this was a big no!
Not impressed. I would not be purchasing this again!

reviews.name: Fallyn Spinks
reviews.title: THEY DO NOT STAY ON
reviews.review: I wanted to try out a different type of pampers since I have had great success with the cruisers and 360s. I wanted to save a couple of $$ so I tried these out. Let me say these are awful! Spend the extra few dollars and stick with the cruisers or 360s. My child rips them off and or they fall off.

reviews.name: Jackie
reviews.title: The smell is too strong
reviews.review: I like that these diapers fit my newborn well but the smell in them is too strong that they make me uncomfortable putting them on my daughter. There shouldn’t be any fragrance in products like these used for intimate parts and newborns. Because of this I do not recommend. The health of my baby is too important to overlook this.

reviews.name: Paris
reviews.title: Must be a bad batch
reviews.review: These pampers are super super thin. Not the usual quality. Have a10 month old who we have always used the pampers brand for but this box is not the same as far as absorption. we have do double up so they won't leak through the clothes during the day. Not even going to address what happens at night.

reviews.name: Michael D. Anderson
reviews.title: Straps keep coming loose
reviews.review:
Unlike the usual brand that I buy (which was out of stock for some reason), I tried these because they were a name brand and yet not the most expensive ones out there. However not only are size 6 a little small for my 2 (almost 3) year old, but the sticky fastner strips don't stay attached (unlike my usual brand). I'm getting requests ten times a day "Daddy please put my diaper back on," which is incredibly annoying.

Also, they are not great for potty training because of the above issues, they don't pull down for him to use the bathroom except with great difficulty. I would not buy again and would not recommend.

reviews.name: Catherine
reviews.title: Strong urine smell
reviews.review: These diapers have a stron chemical smell. As soon as my 2 month old pees on it, amo is smell becomes strong. I even thought that by baby might’ve had an UTI due to the strong odor, however after reading numerous reviews I figured it was the diaper. I ended switching brands.

reviews.name: Dane Sorensen
reviews.title: Not great
reviews.review: The diapers are rather rough and have no soft lining to them. The side sticky things come on done very easily and allow leaking.

reviews.name: Rose
reviews.title: Get swaddlers instead!
reviews.review: Wanted to try out this regular diaper instead of the Pampers Swaddlers because the quantity was more for a cheaper price and was so disappointed with the blow out. I’d recommend spending a bit more with the swaddlers - I never had an issue with blowouts.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Cheap
reviews.review: Thin and cheap, doesn’t compare to swaddlers.

reviews.name: DJ
reviews.title: Smells awful
reviews.review: These have an incredibly strong scent to them. It would make my partner and me extremely nauseous. I also didn’t like that these didn’t have the little butt flap thing in the back of the diaper to prevent leakage up the back.
