However, there is enough material to fold your own, but doing so made the diaper fit baggy in the back for my baby. These also seem to be made for slim babies. My baby has chunky thighs and round belly, so the competitor’s diapers fit a bit better.

reviews.name: Simon
reviews.title: Very strong scent, not mentioned on package; not recommended
reviews.review: The usual pampers but with a very strong scent that they apply to US pampers. It was so strong that I had to store them in a separate room. If you're not used to this scent, do not buy them. I will definitely not buy them again.

reviews.name: Stephanie G
reviews.title: Deceptive
reviews.review: Just buy Luvs, they are cheaper and made exactly the same way as these with the crisscross pattern. Since they are made by the same company I don't like the upcharge for using essentially the same product.

reviews.name: Kira
reviews.title: We did not like this version of pampers
reviews.review: Pampers Swaddler are way better than these diapers bit costly as well than this.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: They leak
reviews.review: I hate these my baby got rash, they are thin and they leak

reviews.name: Sheryl Kolka
reviews.title: Soft but tabs don’t stick well
reviews.review: These are not what they use to be, the tabs don’t stick and diapers easily fall off inside of clothes and they leak horribly. I am very disappointed and won’t buy again

reviews.name: Sadie
reviews.title: Disappointed
reviews.review: I am a religious pampers user and I’m disappointed with these diapers. They are so thin that they don’t soak anything up. Which is leading to a blow out literally every time baby poops. Then I have to use stain remover and run a load of laundry. Not worth saving the money, get the swaddlers over the baby dry!!

reviews.name: Mario
reviews.title: Pampers ran SMALL this time
reviews.review: I think there may have been a production issue with this Lot, because we have always used pampers and never had this issue. We even compared them to the size two’s we had before this box and there is definitely a difference. Will not keep us from buying again. But just to make it known.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: What should stay closed so not.
reviews.review: I tried 2 different sizes because the Velcro tabs do not keep the pamper properly closed. There is a gap and the Velcro tab is so small/short it do not cover enough to keep the pamper affixed. I used them on 2 different toddlers that are 2 different sizes and they both had the same issue. The Velcro tab came loose and this caused a clean up issues and their clothes to get wet. When the pamper stayed affixed it did not leak but the issue remains that more often then not it did not stay affixed.

reviews.name: V v v nice
reviews.title: Not happy . Bad quality
reviews.review:
The size is a little compressed and my baby is 26.5 lbs and if I go with other brand's like Huggies the size 4 fits perfect and it's of a quality that it absorbs wetness in it.. I mean from outer surface you can't feel if the diaper is filled or not in other diapers.. but in this . You can literally feel wetness in your hands if you lift up the baby.

I hate Pampers now.. I ordered this big pack.. I am waiting for it to get over and me buying Huggies again.

reviews.name: Andres Duran
reviews.title: No longer a happy customer..
reviews.review: My son used these pampers for night time and the regular baby dry for day time since he was old enough to walk at 10 months. After all the disappointing changes they had been to diapers that I was hearing left and right I thought I would be safe with my son using Pampers. 3 months ago (My son at 20 months old) I was forced to go through 3 different day time options because my son started getting horrible rashes along his thighs and back PLUS the diapers started to leak. After his rash went away with the day time I bought a new box of the night time diapers and I thought it please don't change the extra protection line and yup..My son( 2 yr old )has been using this Kanteen for almost now along with a neoprene sleeve from Kidzikoo to drink water from and I love it! He can hold it with no problem, drinks from it with no issues...woke up with rashes on his thighs again. Leaks left and right. I used LUVS when my son was an infant and these diapers are now comparable to what LUVS USED to be (because they have also become completely terrible diapers). However it is that they make their cruisers line I hope they do not change anything about them because those are the higher priced diapers I've ended up using that actually work and don't give my son a rash so far for both day and night time.

reviews.name: Tonya Nicole
reviews.title: Leaky butts much!
reviews.review:
I got these because the OG pampers weren’t going to get to me fast enough… these are junk! Absolutely terrible diapers! They get huge when they are wet and forget about picking up your child and carrying them with a wet diaper because it will leak! I have never had issues with pampers leaking before trying these out.
The elastic on the sides are not nearly as stretchy and they run smaller than the original style. I will likely be giving the remainder to my daycare for any baby in need.

reviews.name: Amanda
reviews.title: Stiff
reviews.review: Very stiff diapers. They do not leak. But they aren't very stretchy. I wouldn't want to wear them.

reviews.name: A.L.
reviews.title: Not even close to leakproof
reviews.review: Terrible for leak protection. My baby wakes up soaking wet every morning. This diaper does not protect well for soiled diapers either. Expensive diapers like these should at least function half as well as generic brands. I’d recommend you go with Huggies Snugglers or Parents Choice as they have an extra band at the back of the diaper to catch any messes that try to escape out the back of the diaper. These Pampers are just awful. I am very very disappointed in the quality.

reviews.name: Kris
reviews.title: Velcro doesn’t work well
reviews.review: Unfortunately, these diapers do not Velcro well and stay attached. My newborn is petite and 8lbs 9oz and the Velcro on these would come off as she wiggles. I wouldn’t purchase again

reviews.name: Marthe mombula
reviews.title: It's not good, the pampers I used to use It's better than this one
reviews.review: It's too thin.

reviews.name: Definitivamente es lo que quería, es hermoso.
reviews.title: No es la calidad que normalmente caracteriza a Pampers
reviews.review: No sé qué pasa con estos Pampers tienen fugas todo el tiempo, también noté que eran más delgados que otros que estaba usando con la misma presentación, estoy realmente confundida y decepcionada no los volvería a comprar, en un principio pensé que era un error pero ahora entiendo que hay algo mal con ellos.

reviews.name: Andrew Butler
reviews.title: Different then other pampers purchased
reviews.review: These are different than other pampers that we have purchased from Amazon. Although they say pampers the are much thinner and does not have the blowout barrier.

reviews.name: Michael K
reviews.title: Smaller than other size 2's.
reviews.review: My baby girl has been wearing size 2 diapers for almost 2 months now. We've tried a hundred different brands and the pampers swaddlers are our favorite, just expensive. So I tried these. To my surprise they didn't fit very well and were not designed well. The tab that you fold out over the front side to stick the diaper on your baby sits a full inch below the top of the back on the diaper. As such there is this weird open area and we found that our baby girl peed all over everything multiple times in these diapers becuase of that design at the back. They are also smaller than every other brand of size 2 we've tried. Which is not less than probably 10 brands.

reviews.name: Dera Peeturdsin
reviews.title: No wetness indicator!?!
reviews.review: So, Pampers Baby Dry diapers have worked well for my son for the first 5 months of his life. Now that he has gotten a bit bigger of a booty, we bought a box of size 3. I thought, same diaper, different size - what could go wrong? Right? EVERYTHING! All of the sudden, there is no wetness indicator on the diapers! Why would they have them on size 2 and not on size 3? Do I all of the sudden not need to be able to see right away if my baby's diaper is wet? I mean, they still work to soak up poop and pee, but it is harder to tell in the middle of the night. VERT ANNOYING!!!! Also, what is up with the strong fragrance? It reminds me of when stinky guys with bad B.O. just spray cologne on instead of showering. Don't try so hard to cover up the smell!

reviews.name: Bdoggie
reviews.title: Same as generic
reviews.review:
These were a waste of money. We've been using pampers cruisers with no issues for probably a year or so, but these were cheaper... Sometimes you get what you pay for.
After back to back to back bedding changes due to the diapers not staying closed, the rest of the box is rotting in the basement along with boxes of other "cheaper" diapers that were crap.
Maybe it was a bad batch or something, but for us it's not worth the aggravation. Just buy the good ones! 😊

reviews.name: Nicole Valenti
reviews.title: Not good for overnight
reviews.review: I wanted these to work so badly. They are only good for short periods of time/daytime diapers. Whenever I put my baby in them overnight he always leaks through and soaks his clothes and sheets. They work perfectly fine and no issues during the day because we change so frequently but just don't cut it for long stretches of sleep.

reviews.name: halfsuh
reviews.title: Very rough bumps inside the diapers
reviews.review: Every diaper had a rough bumpy texture in the lining of the waist band in the back and front. Won’t ever buy again. Pampers Swaddlers are way better, Huggies are also better.

reviews.name: Book Reader
reviews.title: Very small
reviews.review: Item described as suitable for 40+ pounds. My disabled child is 39 to 40 pounds, average weight and height for age. These diapers won't fit around her waist and don't cover behind. They look and fit like a size 5 rather than the size 7 they are supposed to be.

reviews.name: Gracie Martini
reviews.title: not too good
reviews.review: i didnt realize Pampers had high end and low end. i had pampers but apparently they were swaddlers and worked great. i thought i was just ordering a bigger box of pampers but these look different inside. they do not have the same "technology" as the others i forget what they call the air vents or air weave or something. i hardly ever had leaks with the former (it was either a long time between changes or we velcroed it in not the right spot- our fault) but we have leaks more frequently with these. if you like the value, i would say buy the size up for more absorbency (if your baby is close to the size) and change him a little more frequently.

reviews.name: sammy_1620
reviews.title: Leaked
reviews.review:
We had a case of pampers baby dry that we LOVED for our newborn. As soon as she got into size one, it was a no brainer to keep using the baby-dry

We have used this case of diapers for 2 days and they have leaked twice. Last night, all into her bed, pjs, and swaddle. She has never leaked through the newborn ones. These seem thin and rough. The front doesn’t have any kind of tab to extend over her legs, so the front ends up scrunching up.
Our daughter is by no way a chunky baby. Shes around 12 pound (little less) and at least 25” long. These just didn’t play out like the newborn which is disappointing.

We are returning these immediately.

reviews.name: JvW
reviews.title: The size is off!
reviews.review:
I wanted to use baby dry during the night, because I had a good experience with them with my other 2 kids 9+ years ago.
Unfortunately, I will have to donate the 100+ diapers I’m sitting on, because they are too small. During the day we use Pampers Pure size 2 and they are perfect. My baby weights 13 lbs and is on the short side. The back of the diaper isn’t high enough (hello blow out!) and the straps are too short.
Size up if you want to be on the safe side!

reviews.name: Ashley M.
reviews.title: Not Leakproof!
reviews.review: I bought these because my 4 month old starting sleeping on her tummy, and was waking up wet every morning! Unfortunately, these do not help with that situation. They are not leak proof, and definitely do not stay dry. They leak more than any other diaper I've tried!

reviews.name: Jennifer Dye
reviews.title: Lots of leaks
reviews.review: The diapers smell great, but if you don't change them right away, they leak. My son has peed through 4 diapers in the past 2 days and he gets changed frequently. This morning, within an hour and a half of having a clean, dry diaper, he had wet clothes.

reviews.name: Deta
reviews.title: Not a Pampers quality! Just buy Pampers swaddles instead!
reviews.review: I usually buy Pampers swaddles and I think it is the best so far. I try Pampers Dry because it is slightly cheaper and I trust the brand. When I open the package I have my doubts. The quality is so far behind swaddles! The things that I dont like about this diaper: 1.The material not as good as swaddles. 2.Strong perfume (I am worry that might irritate my baby's skin). 3.The size smaller (you can see it from my photos. On the right is swaddles size 3, on the left Pampers dry size 4) I would try it anyway and see what happens. But next time I will go back to swaddles.

reviews.name: tiggrr2001
reviews.title: New style leaks and doesn't fit as well
reviews.review: I'm not sure why Pampers changed these diapers. The new style is definitely not as absorbent or leak proof as the prior. My son used to be able to sleep through the night or go longer periods of time without leaking, but not anymore. We recently went on vacation and while on the plane, his diaper leaked on me and my husband on different occasions. We had to change his outfits 3+ times. This was never an issue until now. He's also started breaking out in rashes when he hadn't previously. As a test, I put him back in a Pampers Pure diaper last night to sleep. No leaks when he woke up and the rash was gone.

products.product_name: Pampers Diapers - Swaddlers 360 - Size 5, 116 Count, for up to 100% Leakproof Premium Skin Protection

reviews.name: Dayton Saling
reviews.title: Great for potty training
reviews.review: We just started potty training and tried the pampers baby dry 360 and did not like them. They felt cheap. Found these and LOVED them. We were a swaddlers family to begin with. Love that they made a "pull up" option in swaddlers. They are soft and absorbent. My child can easily pull down and pull up. Great value especially if you use the subscribe and save option!

reviews.name: S Wang
reviews.title: Leakproof, soft, but a bit pricey.
reviews.review:
Bought these for my toddler for reliable leak protection during the night.

What I like • The 360-degree waistband ensures a snug fit and prevents leaks. • The diapers are soft and gentle on my toddler's skin. • Provides excellent absorbency, even overnight, keeping my child dry.

What could be better • They could be a bit more breathable to prevent skin irritation during hot weather. • The size options could be more flexible for toddlers at the higher end of the size range. • The price is higher compared to other diaper brands.

Bottom line: A great choice for leakproof protection and comfort, but a bit pricey. Perfect for parents seeking premium leak protection, but consider alternatives if you're looking for a more affordable option.

reviews.name: Kingsly Zalaquett
reviews.title: Love these
reviews.review: Worth every penny. These are the best. Easy on and off yet sturdy like the original swaddlers. We still use swaddlers nighttime diapers for over night but these are great for the day and fine for naps.

reviews.name: amber swartout
reviews.title: Great diapers
reviews.review: Best diapers when you have a toddler easy to pull up and I just love these diapers especially when you trying to potty train your little one

reviews.name: Julie
reviews.title: We love these
reviews.review: These are amazing - they're stretchy but also secure. My 5 month old is 20 lbs and 26 inches long, and she is constantly wiggling and whatnot. These don't squeeze her tummy

reviews.name: Madeline Q.
reviews.title: These convinced me to switch from Huggies
reviews.review:
I’ve been a Huggies mom with all 3 of my kids, but 360 Swaddlers have converted me to Pampers! This 3rd baby is a different breed and can alligator roll like an actual animal. Slipping 360s on instead of trying to pin her down is keeping me sane.

They haven’t leaked at all. I just tear the seams at the sides to take the diapers off to keep things mess free.

Make sure you don’t size up too much since there are no traditional tabs to place tighter.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: High quality
reviews.review: I’ve tried all the diapers and these are my favorite. If you have a toddler with a larger bum, these fit so much better than Huggies or Kirkland brand. They absorb well and do not irritate his skin. I also like the smell of them.

reviews.name: Ringchen Lepcha Kish
reviews.title: Great
reviews.review: Great product fast delivery.

reviews.name: Samaar
reviews.title: My favorite
reviews.review: These have been our favorite diapers for our active 2 year old! Very easy to put on and off. Leakage has been very minimal if any.

reviews.name: Cindy huezo
reviews.title: Volvería a comprar exelente producto
reviews.review: Me ayuda con las fugas

reviews.name: Alexa
reviews.title: Pampers de entrenamiento para niños
reviews.review: Llegaron en buenas condiciones, son buenos pampers

reviews.name: Donald Tynes
reviews.title: Leakproof
reviews.review: Fast delivery. Priced right. Does what is supposed to do…keeps baby dry!

reviews.name: A consumer
reviews.title: The best diaper, hands down!
reviews.review:
Okay, let me just say Pampers Cruisers 360° have changed the game. No more wrestling with diaper tapes while your baby performs acrobatic stunts on the changing table. These pull-on diapers are like the yoga pants of the diaper world: stretchy, comfy, and they stay put. Seriously, I’m convinced my baby could go bungee jumping and these things would still be secure.

But here’s the real magic: the *Blowout Barrier*. I’m no diaper expert, but I’m pretty sure this is what’s standing between my baby and the chaos of a full-on "explosion." Wetness? Locked away. Leaks? Never heard of her. I’m pretty sure Pampers Cruisers 360° are made of some kind of diaper sorcery. Plus, they’re hypoallergenic and free of all the bad stuff, so you don’t have to worry about your baby’s skin getting a surprise.

It’s like they took everything that was annoying about diapers, fixed it, and handed us the ultimate solution. If your baby’s a wiggle monster or a midnight diaper-remover, these are your new best friend. 10/10, would diaper-change again.

reviews.name: Yoyo
reviews.title: Pampers
reviews.review:
Package Like new.
Good for moving toddlers no leaks.
good value for money. Designed for blowouts.

reviews.name: Maria
reviews.title: Pampers
reviews.review: So comfy, no leaking, baby smell.

reviews.name: Ramona de la Rosa Moya
reviews.title: Me encanta
reviews.review: Son muy buenos

reviews.name: Candice
reviews.title: Love thesee
reviews.review: I started using them when my son started to take his diapers off which were the stick on ones. It’s been a game changer for me. Easy slip on with a tape at the back to roll the diaper up after use . Year the sides which is easy to do for taking off. Holds pee in well and its a good price for the amount that comes in the package

reviews.name: Ivy
reviews.title: So nice for quick diaper changes- especially with toddlers!
reviews.review: These diapers are the best! I was told to try pull on diapers when my daughter started ripping hers off so we switched to these about a year ago and haven’t had any issues since! They’re absorbent, easy to slip on, and honestly very convenient.

reviews.name: AP
reviews.title: Gift for coworker
reviews.review: Coworkers family has 2 already in diapers with third on the way. Safe bet on diapers and they were not disappointed. Luckily this is not the brand that has given them leakage and rash problems for their children

reviews.name: Am Custome
reviews.title: Worked so well on my toddler that I tried them
reviews.review: Very high quality! After my toddler did so well with these protecting their skin, I gave it a try. I now provide maximum value to the client through being able to work without bathroom breaks.

reviews.name: Carl Young
reviews.title: cost
reviews.review: good product

reviews.name: Rachelle Mitchell
reviews.title: Clean and dry
reviews.review: Great fit

reviews.name: Ariess
reviews.title: Hands down the best diapers
reviews.review: We’ve been a pampers family for the past 15yrs. I’ve been using swaddlers om 2yr old since the NICU since that’s what they had in preemie size. We switched to cruisers when she started crawling then the cruiser 360 when I had to fight for my life to get a diaper on her lol yall know that stage where they have infinite strength haha I accidentally ordered these one day & I say accidentally cuz I didn’t know they had swaddled 360s , I thought I was ordering the same cruisers. They came & I was so confused lol but I’m so glad cuz I absolutely love them & wish I would’ve realized sooner . The fit is so much better than the cruisers. Putting the 2 next to each you can see the size difference. They are lot softer too.

reviews.name: jtnance135
reviews.title: Fit perfect!
reviews.review: I’m a mid 40’s man and these fit me perfectly! They won’t hold a full adult load so I recommend frequent changes. Only had 36 leaks out of almost 60 diapers! Just make sure to have a few layers of sheets and your sheet won’t stain the mattress. I do wish they were heavily scented with oak or bergamot though, it’s hard to get the sheet smell off of the dangles.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Very good diaper
reviews.review: Is the only diaper that will hold or halfway hold the boys from being soaking wet when they wake up

reviews.name: Jason Runzer
reviews.title: Favorite!
reviews.review: This has to be one of the best diapers out there. It makes it super easy to change her when she is being fussy and we have not had any issues with leaks.

reviews.name: Jennifer Potter
reviews.title: Life changer!
reviews.review: Baby #6 here…after trying every brand on baby #1, Pampers are the only brand diapers I will put on my baby. No rashes, no imprints around their legs, no leaks. These 360s are a game changer, no pun intended. My 8 month old is too busy to stay still for a diaper change. These 360s are much easier to get on a baby on the go. Thank you pampers!

reviews.name: Ruth Apolos
reviews.title: Diapers so relaxing and comfortable for my little baby girl
reviews.review: Very good and comfortable for my daughter

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Amazing diapers
reviews.review: These pampers diapers are a game changer. They are like pull-ups, but they’re for babies so if you have a crazy baby that does not like their pants changed this is one that you can do put them on why they’re on their tummy on their side and the thing is they have this cool thing on the back that when you are changing them and you’re done, you just roll up and pull that sticky part over and closes the diaper. She wears a size 3 and there’s still room for her to probably stay in them for a while. We’ve had no leaking issues. She stays dry she can stay in a diaper all night and not wake up so these are definitely worth your money and I would buy the big box because they are awesome

reviews.name: K.T. Rowe
reviews.title: Best Pampers Swaddlers Creation
reviews.review: I'm at the potty training stage with my almost two-year-old. They are not at the stage/size for the easy-ups, and I prefer to stick to the Pampers brand. Finding this was a fantastic find. The quality is phenomenal. I feel like im getting the best for my buck. The colors are neutral to gender. There is no leakage, and this was a big concern for me. And absorbency is 👌🏽. The thought behind this particular product was considerable, as children are of various sizes.

reviews.name: Adrien Parson
reviews.title: Best 360 protection
reviews.review: Best diapers

reviews.name: Mary kallio
reviews.title: Quality great.
reviews.review: Great.

reviews.name: Karel Ramon Rodriguez Diacen
reviews.title: Eficiente!
reviews.review: Absorben bastante , a mi bebé le dura toda la noche sin necesidad de cambio !

reviews.title: Love them!
reviews.review: Best pull ups holds well

reviews.name: Geordan
reviews.title: The BEST Training Diapers For My Toddler
reviews.review: I have had these on subscription for my potty training son. They are so soft and gentle on him and I love that the sides easily rip down and the strip on the back has adhesive to roll them up for easy disposal. I also love the yellow stripe that turns blue indicating it has been wet in. My son knows he gets a surprise if his stripe is still yellow. These make potty training so much easier!

reviews.name: Steve & Steph's RV Adventures
reviews.title: Excellent absorbency and easy to use
reviews.review:
I had heard my daughters talk about the 360 diapers and wanted to have some on hand for when I am babysitting the grandbabies (I have 2 that fit the size 3 - one girl and one boy), so when I saw these in Vine I ordered them.

I love that they work like the training diapers that pull on rather than wrestling the baby to get the tabs on straight. I was concerned that taking them off would be messy, but they tear along the seams really easily.

Then I wondered how to wrap them up to seal in the ick before disposing, but there is a strip on the back of the diaper you can use to secure the soiled diaper. Another plus for grandparents and new parents is that the back of the diaper is marked clearly. This is important because of how the design allows for more absorption in the areas where the mess and liquid will be concentrated.

I sent my granddaughter home in one and her mom reported that there was only a tiny leak in the morning on the back of the diaper, but not significant enough to be concerned or remove a star.

One thing to mention is that with these diapers, its pretty impossible to put them back on in the case of a "false alarm" so be sure to check carefully that a change is warranted before ripping it off!

reviews.name: Amazon Jane
reviews.title: Cool design pull up diapers
reviews.review:
This an opportune time for this new product to come out because my 10 month old has gotten very wiggly during diaper changes, resulting in lopsided hip closures which can leave space open for leaks.

These pull ups do fit very well. Even though my son is now wearing a size 4 with most diapers, these size 3s fit great. My son is 18.5 pounds and it says that the size 3 for this diaper should fit until 28 pounds.

They are very easy to pull up even though they fit tightly to prevent leaks.

I’m not sure I have totally figured out the pull tab you use to take it off but they are also easy to take off.

Very absorbent.

The only reason they get a 4 instead of a 5 is that they have a horrible baby powder type fragrance fairly heavily sprayed on them. I would be much more certain about reordering them if they have a fragrance free option, because I do really like the design.

EDIT: I have upgraded this product from four to five stars because the fragrance has grown on me. Probably because the design is so good. I still don’t prefer the fragrance but it also isn’t so bad that I can’t benefit from using these excellent pull up diapers. It has now started to smell more like vanilla, Dr Pepper, and baby powder.

reviews.title: Perfect start to potty training
reviews.review:
These pampers pull-on diapers were a wonderful stepping stone for us into the world of potty training, They made our little feel like a big girl, and over time she began to dislike the feeling more and more of being "wet" and she more or less kick-started herself for potty training.

In good true fashion, these like any Pampers, have great absorption, are leak-proof, fit great, and do not leave any marks nor did my child have any rash or irritation from this product. These are great for those littles that are always on the move, and wiggly too! But again, they are PULL-ON diapers and not your traditional diaper. Same great quality as would expect from any Pampers product.

These were a true game changer in our household!

I personally don't see a use for these unless you're trying to potty train. Trying to put a baby, who doesn't know how to stand up on their own, in this kind of diaper isn't ideal. The elasticity and absorbency is fine.

reviews.review: Pampers swaddles are soft on baby's skin, but I've found these to have a lot of fuzzies left on baby's skin and sensitive areas. For name brand diapers, they are kind of thin so we have to change baby more frequently and make sure we clean him very well with each diaper change to get the fuzz out of creases, folds, and such. These diapers are pricey compared to other brands that are more absorbent, cleaner all around, and softer. I have noticed that the leg holes are not made for chunky babies. The elastic digs into my son, even when sizing up. These leak very easily as well. Especially if baby has a blowout, folding the back down doesn't help at all. I just feel like Pampers aren't what they used to be in terms of quality. It seems the price keeps going up while quality goes down. I can get double the amount of diapers in other brands for the price of pampers, and the other diapers are better all around.

reviews.name: Kathleen H.
reviews.title: Worth Every Penny if You Don't Like Leaky Diapers
reviews.review:
These diapers are great - especially at night. I've used this brand since my son was born, and we've had...maybe 3 or 4 diaper leaks/blowouts? When I briefly tried to use Huggies, my son would constantly pee through his diapers. I also briefly used the Costco Kirkland diapers, which were okay. These, hands down, are the best. And they're cheaper on Amazon than they are at my local grocery store!

After my son was born, a friend of mine gave me a great tip - when your baby sleeps put them in a diaper that is one size larger, and it helps them sleep through the night. I started it early on, and my son slept through the night at four weeks. I swear part of it had to do with these super absorbent diapers. When he was really little and I didn't size up, he would wake up more often. He's 19 months old now and sleeps lie,my rock, but sizing up early on made a huge difference. And these are such great diapers, I never had to worry about leaks.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: It seems like I'll be sticking Pampers out until we're through with diapers all together.
reviews.review: I used Pampers swaddlers on my daughter until she was in size three. At that point, I decided to try and save some money by switching to LUVS. A few boxes in, it seemed like every diaper I put on my daughter would bust, so I tried Target's Up & Up brand. Now I love their wipes and for a while, I loved their diapers too, but before too long, she started soaking her clothes during the day. I figured it was time to go up a size. I moved my 22 lb. one year old to size fives and the leaking persisted. So here I am, two sizes later, back to where I started. It's been a few months now and I've had not one single problem with these diapers. It seems like I'll be sticking Pampers out until we're through with diapers all together.

reviews.name: PA Super Mom
reviews.title: Diaper Delivery is a Must for Busy Moms
reviews.review: As a busy mom I'm always thankful when Amazon Prime carries many of the essential baby items I need. The convenience factor of arriving home to a large box of diapers cannot be beat. I've found the prices to be competitive with other retailers (with coupons). As far as the diapers themselves go, I switched from Pampers Swaddlers when my daughter was about 8-9months old and started to wet through her diapers at night. I've found that the Baby Dry version absorbs more, and seems to keep her dry better than some of the other brands. We use the Pampers baby dry diapers during the day, and Huggies Overnight diapers at night.

reviews.name: J. Michelle
reviews.title: Excellent diaper
reviews.review:
Pampers has always been my favorite brand of diaper. I never experienced any leaks while using the brand. This collection is one their cheaper diapers but I never had any problems with it. They are pretty soft, the don't make much noise with movement and the characters on them is pretty cute.

This box however is about a two to three week supply. It's a bit expensive for the amount of diapers in the box. For this price I can get a one month supply at Beejays. Overall this is a good buy but it's not a budget friendly option.

reviews.name: Saba
reviews.title: Only diapers I order!
reviews.review:
I have a six month old daughter and we tried Pampers vs. Huggies. We purchased Huggies once as we are Costco customers and that is the brand they sell. My husband saw the difference in price and asked me to give it a try (though I had read many reviews that recommend Pampers over Huggies). Well, he learned his lesson. Huggies smelled and leaked. Now, he recommends Pamper's all the way.

They are comfortable. They don't feel cheap. They don't leak except for the explosions every now and then - which I think would be the case with any company. They don't smell foul. Huggies diapers would smell right away even if it was just a little tinkle.

I recommend these after your child is done with Pampers Swaddlers (those are my all time favorite).

Every now and then if he’s had a lot to drink our son can still leak through one during a nap, even though it says 12 hours protection. Still, they don’t leak as much as other brands we’ve tried and they keep the diaper rash at bay. So, I can handle a couple of wet outfits every so often.

reviews.name: Mom
reviews.title: Watch out for SHARP diaper tabs!
reviews.review: These are great but BE CAREFUL to line up the tabs within the outline on the front of the diaper. They are so sharp that if they have any contact with baby's skin, they will absolutely cut and leave a scab. I had these on my baby before he could talk and couldn't figure out what he was crying about. Finally realized the tabs were poking him so hard they broke skin. Poor little guy. If you make sure to line up the tabs, they are great diapers. I don't know why Pampers doesn't fix this!

The way the diaper is put on makes a difference as well. We went up a size and I make sure as much of the diaper is in the front section as possible. Then it put the tabs right at the top. We are still going to use these diapers but also an extra insert for added protection.

reviews.title: used pampers baby dry all the time and we loved them because the overnight diapers will hold up very ...

Fast forward to not to my 19 month old son, we have also only used pampers baby dry, however about 2 months ago pampers baby dry made an "upgrade" to their diaper design, this is what their customer representative I communicated with told me after I had bought a brand new box and my son ended up getting soaking wet the first night with the new design. I still had a couple of diapers of the older version and compared them and reached out to pampers to tell them that I though they had packed the wrong diapers because the older version was ticker and held much better, again, I have used Pampers baby dry for years! Since them I have bought 2 more boxes with the hopes that it would work for us again, as it did for years, but I have to change my son's clothes at least twice a night because the pee goes through everywhere. I have sized up as well, but still the same issue. Please pampers, go back to your prior product, the new one is garbage!!! Unfortunately I am going to have to change brands now, I hope I can find the right replacement.

Another major issue, straps are not sticky at all...
I have used pampers swaddlers until his 1st birthday it was very good.but this pampers baby dry i give Zero star rating please .
Kirkland size 5 is fitting and comfortable for him in my view not sure how it goes with others .

This is the reason why I choose subscribe for this brand diaper. However, when we got this new box diaper two days ago, I found my son got seriously rash. Actually, we noticed the characters on the diaper changed and the diaper also was super thin, I thought maybe they modified the products and made it better. Now I think they DO change their materials but only made it worse! I also compared the new box and the previous ones, found the old ones were made in USA and the new box one were made in Mexico. I've attached images of the old diapers we had vs. the new ones that I am pointing to. I will change to buy the diapers from local supermarket not from Amazon.

reviews.name: Ama Zony
reviews.title: Two different versions of this diaper with major quality differences
reviews.review:
There are two different versions of this diaper! When I received our last box of Baby Dry diapers I thought we had received a cheap knock off. The only reason I could tell they are actually from Pampers is because the rewards code worked on their website. The diapers looked completely different, had characters from Plaza Sésamo, were SUPER thin, and did not keep my toddler dry through the night. While we've had occasional leaks before this was different.. it leaked in the belly area which has never happened before but also is not surprising since there is hardly any padding in these diapers. Paper thin and scratchy feeling!

Our guess is these diapers were manufactured by Pampers and made much cheaper for other countries. The characters on the diapers are from a different version of Sesame St. My guess is these do not meet USA standards as they weren't produced for this country. We decided not to risk using these with our daughter and will no longer be purchasing diapers through Amazon since you can't know what you'll be getting. I've attached an image of the old diapers we had vs. the new ones that I am pointing to.

If you receive junky diapers like we did contact Amazon and they will refund your money. We will be purchasing through Walmart or Target from now on to guarantee we don't receive these thin, scratchy diapers again.

products.product_name: Pampers Diapers Newborn/Size 1 (8-14 lb), Pure Protection Disposable Baby Diapers, Hypoallergenic and Unscented Protection, Super Pack (Old Version), Size 1, 74 Count

reviews.name: Alise M
reviews.title: Finally, a healthier diaper with a great fit!
reviews.review:
We’re only one day into using these so I can’t comment on performance just yet, but I had trouble finding a review online so wanted to give a bit of info for those considering purchasing.

I’ve been using Honest diapers on my 4 month old and really love the company and product - except for the diapers’ fit. My baby is chunky and I find their diapers to run very narrow. This wasn’t an issue early on, but as he’s grown, their narrow cut has resulted in more blowouts and I found we needed to put him in a size too big just to get a comfortable fit. The fit was still “off” and of course, sizing up means fewer diapers per bundle, which I wasn’t happy about. I’ve spent the last couple of weeks trying other brands in hopes of finding a better fit.

I really wanted to use a diaper made with as few toxic ingredients as possible. Unfortunately, most “eco conscious” diapers fit like Honest’s - narrow, which I think is best for a long, skinny baby. I found Seventh Generation, Babyganics and Earth’s Best all to have a similar shape. Earth’s Best performed particularly well from an absorportion standpoint, so if you have a long and skinny baby you might try those.

Discouraged by the fit of those other brands, I tried Huggies Little Snugglers and Pampers Gentle Care (FYI Gentle Care was comfirmed by P&G as being the exact same diaper as Sensitive Care, just sold exclusively at Target). Both fit well! However, Huggies puts these obnoxious double grip tabs on their diapers beginning with size 3 which can rub against a baby’s thigh, causing serious irritation (check out reviewers’ photos to see what I’m talking about). Pampers Gentle Care fit great and contained mess well, but my baby got a mild rash - his first ever - which I suspect was from the fragrance. This reinforced my desire to use a diaper with healthier ingredients.

I was ready to resign myself to using an ill-fitting diaper like Honest or Earth’s Best when I came across these brand new diapers and I am SO glad I gave Pampers another try. Initial reaction is that these are the same size and shape as Pampers Gentle Care (and, I’d think, regular Pampers Swaddlers) and are also just as soft. NONE of the eco-conscious diapers I’ve tried are soft, so this is amazing! The print is cute without being obnoxious, and the inside contains the same mesh liner as other Pampers. So far, I’m thrilled.

If your baby is sensitive to Pampers fragrance, or you have a chunky baby but want to try a healthier disposable, I strongly suggest checking these out! I just hope that Amazon soon offers subscribe and save, as these are quite pricey compared to other diapers in this category - even a bit more than Honest when purchased in their monthly bundle.

See my photo for a visual comparison of this diaper against Honest size 4, Earth’s Best size 4 (top row, left to right) and Honest size 3 and Pampers Gentle Care size 3 (bottom row). The Pure Protection size 3 is the diaper in the middle of the bottom row.

reviews.name: TheSovereign
reviews.title: Very impressive!
reviews.review:
We have been using Swaddlers on our little one since she came home from the NICU in tandem with cloth and this one appeases both. They have yet to leak, are truly sensitive skin proof and still have the Pampers 12 hour protection... on even the chubbiest thighs! The design is sweet and simple and doesn't push gender OR branding WHICH WE LOVE. She can share a Pamper during a playdate with anyone! Pics are included as proof of how happy our princesa is!

While I miss the sweet baby smell of Swaddlers, I love the wet indicator on these going past size 2. They are so close to cloth, the only thing better would be them being biodegradable!

reviews.name: Sara R.
reviews.title: Almost perfect
reviews.review: We started with Pampers Swaddlers and got a little weirded out by the little gel clumps that were coming out of them. Then we switched Honest diapers for about a year but the fit just isn't great and they always leak overnight. Now we have landed on these Pamper's Pure diapers for the time being for our 20 month old. I wish they were more biodegradable and they aren't quite as "pure" as I would like, but dang they work well! They are soft, they can *usually* last overnight (the Honest Overnights almost always leaked for us, and these ones leak maybe once a week) and they fit really well. It's also nice to just have one diaper for night and day, not that that's a huge deal. As a parent I feel like we can never win, something is always toxic or bad in some product so I'm sure no matter what we do we'll always hesitate a bit with everything we buy. But overall we have been really happy with these and I'm glad they are at least a step up from a normal diaper as far as healthy ingredients go.

reviews.name: Blair B
reviews.title: Love the new Pure option
reviews.review: I've always been a loyal Pampers user because I know I'll get great leak protection with the diapers. I used the Swaddlers with my first kid a few years ago exclusively because they worked so well. I just had another baby and started to think about using more natural products for this one. I tried a few of the other brands that tout this, but wasn't happy because they didn't hold in all of the leaks. I received a gift card to try out the new Pampers Pure diapers so ordered these to give it a try. So far - they are great! They offer the same protection from leaks that I know and love from Pampers diapers, but I love that these have no lotions or fragrances. Definitely recommend these for parents looking for a more natural option!

reviews.name: JH/AR
reviews.title: You get what you pay for
reviews.review: I’ve tried almost every brand of diaper and after my son constantly getting rashes with others we always went back to pampers Swaddlers and have used them 95% of the time during our two year old sons life. I’ve tried honest diapers and liked them but not as much as pampers, so the thought of a safer version of the diaper we already use was a win. I’ll admit they’re pretty pricey but they are by far my favorite diaper we’ve ever used so I’ll continue to buy them as long as the budget allows it. They’re so so soft, have no smell and super cute too. I also found they’re a tad bigger. I was considering sizing my son up but I can definitely keep his same size now and have even thought of trying a sample pack in the size down since you get more diapers in smaller sizes. Haven’t had any issues with the diaper tabs like some have said. So overall even though they’re pricey, I feel they’re worth it.

reviews.name: Jesse t.
reviews.title: Best diapers!
reviews.review: I went from pampers swaddlers to these. I wanted to try safer diapers that also wouldnt leak. My baby had a little rash i noticed not going away. I changed to these diapers and she is all better. These diapers are the best. They are softer, seem thicker, and way better to her skin. Also, these diapers protect from leaks better than the swaddlers, in my opinion. We will be sticking with this brand from now on.

reviews.name: HappyAmazonCustomer
reviews.title: Super absorbant, NO scent & very soft!
reviews.review: These fit my son great for a nighttime diaper. Luckily it's slightly larger than Huggies size 1, but they still fit well. They are absorbent enough to last an entire night. Which is great! Only seldomly do I need to change my 4-5 month old son's diaper during the night (always pee). Even if I use this diaper during the daytime, it does hold very well with breastmilk poo. Overall, these are great. No scent either! Whew! And super SUPER soft!!!

reviews.name: HUNG YUAN CHENG
reviews.title: good
reviews.review: good👍👍👍👍👍

reviews.name: Shelby
reviews.title: Will Purchase Again
reviews.review: We are TCF and typically order a different brand of diapers. We ran out and decided to purchase these to hold us over. Our son didn’t get any rashes and no leaks occurred.

reviews.name: Alyssa
reviews.title: LOVE these diapers!
reviews.review: I really like this diapers. What I love most is that, unlike the Pampers Swaddlers, they don’t have that diaper scent. Also, I’ve used the Swaddlers and they seem to run smaller than the Pampers Pure even though both are the same size. The Pampers Pure just fit so much better. The designs are adorable- I love the sloth ones! :) I’ve used these since my son was born three months ago and we’ve never had a leak- the few we did have was due to first time mommy error by not making the diaper tight enough. These are just great diapers!

reviews.name: Lolla Belle
reviews.title: Great Overnight
reviews.review: My daughter has slept through the night since she was 4 months old, and we discovered these when she was around 9 months. She's been wearing them as night diapers ever since. We use a green brand of diaper throughout the day, and they fit and work well with her sensitive skin, but aren't that absorbent. The Pamper's Pure are very absorbent, keeping her skin dry after ten hours of sleeping and thoroughly soaking the diaper. She also has sensitive skin and these have never irritated her.

reviews.name: yhrpr87
reviews.title: Best diaper out there!
reviews.review: I love these diapers! My baby can’t wear anything that isn’t pampers, and these by far are the best for her. They seem wide enough for her butt and handle her hyperactivity like no other. I was opting for the Cruisers 360 bc she was also taking her diapers off, but I don’t like the way those close, so ill keep buying these. She doesn’t take them off and even if she tried, they are more secure than other diapers for some reason. My only regret is why didn’t I buy them sooner.

reviews.name: Sam
reviews.title: Very Soft and fits well!
reviews.review:
I was using pampers sensitive diaper for my baby since her birth and thought that's the best until I tried this one. I love how soft it is, feels like cotton so I know my baby will be so comfy. I tried different brands, but nothing fits, my baby have very chunky thighs and this one is perfect! Softer than pampers sensitive. We are using size 4 and she's around 20lbs now.
Poop Blowouts can still happen once in awhile but I don't mind because all other diapers I tried (even those stretchable at back) still leaks sometimes . It is also good even for overnights!

reviews.name: Rachel Loves
reviews.title: Rash proof, super comfy, order the next size up for boys
reviews.review: Best diapers, only brand that prevent diaper rash completely, these along with the pure wipes and sometimes I don’t even remember to use diaper cream now, not one rash since a few days after we swapped from regular pampers. They really do offer 12 hours protection, but you DO have to get a size larger then they advertise for boys. The pee came up and out the top at the side a few times and my boy is skinny! I’m on size 4s now and he’s 5 months and 16lb

reviews.name: Katie
reviews.title: Softest diaper around
reviews.review: I received free samples of these diapers from Amazon and loved them. They are incredibly soft, and I’ve had no issues with leaks or anything. Prior to this I had been using huggies, I disliked pampers diapers because I found them to be stiff and the fact that they’re scented is unacceptable to me. However these diapers are far superior to huggies in terms of quality and I feel safe using them on my baby. I’m so pleased they made these unscented. They make a great bedtime diaper for older babies like mine. 5 stars.

reviews.name: Mariela S
reviews.title: Love them!
reviews.review:
I absolutely love pampers pure!
I tried other brands such as babyganics and seventh generation, all in the newborn size. Although I did like them, pampers pure’s fit was better and a bigger than the others. The quality and design holds liquid very well, so much that when my daughter uses them once at times we can barely tell if it has anything in it! They are very soft. We mainly use cloth but when we travel or are out and about this will be our choice!

reviews.name: Kelsey
reviews.title: Not only cute but effective too!
reviews.review: I purchased these on a whim, and I'm happy to say I was not disappointed. We were avid users of honest company diapers but these diapers not only have a wetness indicator strip, which the honest diapers were lacking, they are much softer and more absorbent. My son has very sensitive skin and these diapers haven't caused any breakouts. Not to mention the absorbency which has helped me stop buying night time diapers. I definitely will be using these for the remainder of the time my son is in diapers but for any future children

reviews.name: April D.
reviews.title: Exceeded expectations! No powder smell like regular pampers.
reviews.review: These are literally the BEST diaper I have found. I've tried a ton of others from huggies, luvs, aldi brand to organic types like honest and hello bello. None of them compare to how absorbent and gentle these are. My daughter has very sensitive skin and has never had a rash from these. I've also NEVER had a blow out in these like I have others. Well worth the price.

reviews.name: MsVaughnTV
reviews.title: These made me switch from Honest
reviews.review: I'm an Honest user who made the switch to Pampers Pure. The biggest difference for us is the protection which lasts through the night. My daughter sleeps soooo much better now. Also I love the softness of the diaper (it feels like cloth) and the wetness indicator which helps me know when to change her. Loving these! I feel like I'm getting a high quality diaper that is good enough for my daughter and I don't have to compromise on anything. I get to have it all: safe/thoughtful ingredients, cute designs, softness and protection.

reviews.name: K. Mahoney
reviews.title: Great replacement for the discontinued Huggies Natural
reviews.review: We used Huggies Natural with my 1st as a back up to cloth and we love them and was DEVASTATED when they discontinued them especially when we found out we were pregnant with #2. I was super excited when I found these, with similar features and feel to the Huggies version. The Pampers are not organic like the Huggies were and say "Cotton Enhanced" so I'm not sure how that differs from how Huggies used cotton in theirs but the feel seems very similar.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Great for Newborns or Babies with Diaper Rash
reviews.review: Love these diapers! I have a fat baby and they are big enough to accommodate her baby roles and up the back poops. I was having trouble with Huggies as she kept getting diaper rash however these Pampers Pure are a Godsend! They are a bit more expensive however worth it. I only wish they made bigger boxes. Not sure if I will use them when my daughter gets older (because of price) however we will stick with these until she is eating solid foods.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Great! Better than Swaddlers!
reviews.review: For us, these worked better than Swaddlers. Swaddlers use to leak a lot. So by switching to these no more leaking for us. I like the fact that these have less chemical materials. Our son had a mild rash but when we switched to these, he rarely has. Only issue is that sometimes urine leaks overnight, but it’s probably not made to last 12 hours at night. We instead use Huggies Overnight and that seemed to solve the overnight issue.

reviews.name: Mrs Rudy
reviews.title: Best of the Best
reviews.review: I absolutely love these diapers they're so soft they feel like a cloud they're nice and absorbent they don't have a weird chemical smell to them the prints are cute and I really enjoy them I've tried Honest Company baby Organics I've tried regular Pampers and Huggies up and up dollar store brand Parent's Choice and loves by far this is the most Superior diaper I've used is coming in second place would be regular Pampers I cannot recommend this product enough!

reviews.name: Lindsay H.
reviews.title: Best diapers we’ve tried!
reviews.review: Love the weave. We tried some brands that don’t have the weave and the poop had nowhere to go. These leak less than other diapers, plus they don’t have that diaper fragrance (why do any of the companies use fragrance???). His skin looks great (the fragranced ones tend to give him rashes), and they have a little more room than the Swaddlers so he can wear each size a little longer. Plus they are just so soft!

reviews.name: LAtoParis
reviews.title: I don’t like the chemical smell that the diaper emits once it’s ...
reviews.review: I have a 1 year old and we have used Pampers on her since birth. Never once has a Pampers diaper leaked, even when wearing it overnight. However, I don’t like the chemical smell that the diaper emits once it’s wet and I’ve been interesting in a more natural alternative. I tried these and will now be using these exclusively. The diapers and soft and plush, equally absorbant as the regular pampers, and don’t smell like chemicals. I highly recommend them’

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Amazing
reviews.review: So I was super surprised at how much I love these. I didn’t want to spend the money on them but my daughter constantly has diaper rashes and pampers pure are the only kind that don’t give her a rash. Seemed like a decent price with the wipes, I expected to hate the wipes because I’m not a fan of the pampers sensitive wipes, but I was wrong!!! Much different texture, love them

reviews.name: Ashley Genova
reviews.title: Wonderful!
reviews.review: I received a gift card to try out these New Pampers Pure diapers and I am super impressed. I ordered in the next size up (5) as my 15 month old is a big baby (24-2t clothes) and was seeing how they’d hold up. No leakage or blowouts! They are so soft and really gentle on my Little’s ones skin. Cannot wait to give the wipes a try as well! Will definitely be switching to this brand!

reviews.name: Jal11
reviews.title: Seem almost exactly like swaddlers
reviews.review: Appear to be almost exactly the same as swaddlers. However, these have no scent and might be a smidge smaller. When compared to Huggies little snugglers newborn these are definitely smaller. Huggies are the largest newborn we've found. But Huggies caused all our kids to break out in horrible rashes so back to pampers it is. Luvs is made by pampers but leak quite a bit more.

reviews.name: Josephine Svedmark
reviews.title: Super soft and very absorbent!
reviews.review: LOVE these diapers. They are in my opinion, by far, better than most competing diapers. They are very absorbent and have a cute design and are super soft!! I tried honest diapers because I like the designs but they are very hard and don’t seem comfortable at all. I also like that these pampers pure have the pee detector line, just like the swaddlers.

reviews.name: Joanna May Milk
reviews.title: Five Stars
reviews.review: I have tried several natural diaper brands (Naty, Bambo, Andy Pandy) and these are tied with Andy Pandy as my favorites. They have a wetness indicator, which a lot of diapers don't once your baby is out of newborn sizes. They are thinner than most natural brands but still absorb a ton. And the tabs are a little stretchier, so it's easier to get a snug fit. I normally don't like patterns, but this one is cute and very light colored.

reviews.name: Chelsea B.
reviews.title: No bad stuff no worries and comfort!
reviews.review: I love these! If only they had these when my son was still in diapers. My daughter has the lucky butt though, I was so excited when I got the coupon to try the diapers and wipes out at Wal-Mart last month, she'll be wearing these till she wears undies now, I love how stretchy and comfortable they feel , like cotton wrapping around my hand! Bravo pampers, subbed on Amazon so no worries ♡

reviews.name: Megan McCauley
reviews.title: Soft, nonscented and safe!
reviews.review: First time trying these diapers and was very impressed. Both of my babies have extremely sensitive skin and eczema so I definitely don’t want to but anything with a smell or harsh chemical on them and they had no reaction with Pampers Pure. They are also SUPER soft unlike some other diapers out there so it puts my mind as ease that my little ones are comfortable. Size runs a tad big.

reviews.name: Mrs. Smith
reviews.title: I am glad that Pampers went this way
reviews.review: I am glad that Pampers went this way. We've been using Pampers since my baby was born. We tried many other natural brands but they didn't deliver. We always were back to Pampers. In terms of protection from leaks and absorbency, Pampers Pure are the same as Pampers Cruisers. They work through the night, and my baby drinks a lot at night. My girl is about 21 pounds and we wear size 5.

reviews.name: Dee Major
reviews.title: She makes it through the night leak free which is great and these also feel super soft to the touch ...
reviews.review: Definitely loving the Pampers Pure Protection Diapers from my 15 month old! She makes it through the night leak free which is great and these also feel super soft to the touch (a noticeable difference compared to our old diapers). Love the designs on these as well, super cute! Very happy that Pampers has an even more skin-friendly diaper because my daughter is super sensitive and prone to diaper rashes. No complaints here :)

reviews.name: Jenica
reviews.title: I absolutely love these diapers
reviews.review: I absolutely love these diapers! Other more natural diapers that I have used in the past are extremely stiff and uncomfortable. I need diapers for my babies that are made with pure materials while also being extremely comfortable. I can't believe how soft these are! My baby girl has an especially sensitive bum, and these have significantly helped with her diaper rash, along with using the Pampers Pure wipes. I would recommend these to anyone!

reviews.name: MoonStar
reviews.title: Definitely worth it
reviews.review: I have to admit these are super cute. Very good for sensitive skin. No leaks. Pampers has always been my favorite so I had to try these. As usual you did not disappoint. The price was definitely worth it . Other places charge to much . Always a Pampers fan . Love these . A Must try .

reviews.name: Amanda T.
reviews.title: Good for in-between sizes of Pampers Swaddlers
reviews.review: I have found Pampers Pure diapers to run slightly larger than the Pampers Swaddlers. They make a perfect in-between diaper for when baby is too big for one size of the Pampers Swaddlers but too small for the next size. They are just as soft as the Pampers Swaddlers and do a good job of holding in messes.

reviews.name: trisha b.
reviews.title: Great diapers
reviews.review:
I have a little one with very sensitive skin so I've tried all of the more natural diapers. I found most of them to either feel stiff or not do a good job with leaking.
I love Pampers pure because they do a great job and still feel soft yet have limited ingredients. I also really like the pampers pure wipes, they're soft and do a good job cleaning.

reviews.name: Frey Family
reviews.title: Would buy these again
reviews.review: Good alternative for other natural diapers of comparable price. I'm not sure that I prefer these over, say, Honest Company diapers but of course you can only get those in person or off the website. Generally good quality, as one would expect from Pampers, and I love the wetness indicator. My girl's sensitive skin hasn't had a diaper rash in these yet! Very soft (softer than, say, Seventh Generation diapers), and cute prints.

reviews.name: Abagail Junker
reviews.title: Great for sensitive skin!!
reviews.review: Pampers are the only diapers we use. They are great for my little man's sensitive skin. Every other brand we have tried, made him red and irritated. I felt awful. Other stuck to his butt, but these held over night, during naps, and throughout the day without any explosions, sticking, leaking, or irritation!! I highly recommend.

reviews.name: T. Martinez
reviews.title: Perfect compromise!
reviews.review: Recently my daughter started scratching around her diapers so I wanted to try and find something more natural but we loved the way pampers swaddlers fit her so we opted to try this. The designs are adorable, she has stopped the scratching and they have the same great absorbency as pampers regular diapers.

reviews.name: Rayne Forrest
reviews.title: The new mother loved them
reviews.review: I got these as a shower gift for a co-worker. She eventually asked me where I got them. I know she ordered another box because she has her online purchases shipped to the office. (Nothing gets left on the porch at the office.) She loved them for her little girl and she's very particular.

reviews.name: Vanessa M. Becknell
reviews.title: En
reviews.review: I love these diapers are very thin and very light weight. I love the net looks on the inside. They are very absorbent and hold up very well. They healed up 7 straight over also. Very soft on the inside. I will be buy more. My son has a sensitive behind and these are great to use.

reviews.name: Jessica RiverRain
reviews.title: Best wipes and diapers ever
reviews.review: Pampers are already my favorite but the pure diapers are the best I’ve tried in the past three years of all the brands I’ve tried including pampers. Far superior than honest company in with a more affordable price tag. So soft and cute but also absorbant. I’ll be buying these from now on. The wipes are amazing. Best wipes on the market IMO

reviews.name: Faith
reviews.title: Great for a diaper cake!
reviews.review: I bought these to make a diaper cake and they are great! They have the cutest patterns on them, but the llama ones are white on the back, so you are able to have a solid white printless diaper for the outside of the diaper cake (while using the clothes pin print as the inside of the diaper cake). I would recommend these!

reviews.name: Luci Lyn
reviews.title: Pamper’s Pure Protection is PERFECTION
reviews.review: I LOVE these diapers for several reasons. They are the softest diapers out there! I have a very tall 10 month old who uses the size 5 diapers and I am so happy Pampers created this brand. These diapers use premium cotton, soft plant-based fibers, and are hypoallergenic for my baby's delicate skin. They also don’t leak which is hard to find in soft diapers.

reviews.name: Dara Miller
reviews.title: Great diapers
reviews.review: I absolutely love these diapers. They're a bit pricey, and I've found better deals in stores... but that doesn't take away from the fact that they're amazing. They're super soft and very absorbent and my little lady didn't have a single leak while using them. Wonderful on her skin, too!

reviews.name: SDSSSM
reviews.title: Just as good as swaddlers, but cleaner!
reviews.review: I normally buy Pampers swaddlers and tried these because the natural composition appealed to me. They are just as soft and seemingly as comfortable as swaddlers, and they are equally absorbent. I also appreciate that the decorations on the diaper are faint, so they don’t show up underneath light onesies. I’ll be buying these diapers from now on!

reviews.name: Isabella
reviews.title: Good for price
reviews.review: I do wish they were as soft as the swaddlers but I appreciate how Pampers is offering a clean option for my babies. They absorb pretty well, designs are cute however wish they had more variety. It’s worth it for the price

reviews.name: Natasha Jackson
reviews.title: we always used pampers swaddlers and loved them but these are defiantly are new favorites we ...
reviews.review: we always used pampers swaddlers and loved them but these are defiantly are new favorites we use these wipes now as well and our babies bottom seems the best with this combination not that she had a rash often but they just seem to be more gentle and she is happy.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Love em.
reviews.review: Love the diapers supper absorbant, light in weight no chemical odors, nice feel to them. I was purchasing some super expensive diapers that were not so soft and after a pee the would smell really bad, these don’t smell. My little girl has sensitive skin and gets rashes super easy and these keep her bum nice and dry, no rash.

reviews.name: C.H.
reviews.title: The real deal
reviews.review: I don't write reviews often but these diapers are amazing. My child wears size 4 and we have not had any leaks. I liked them so much I bought 3boxes. The only complaint I have is I wish they had a value pack (105 or more). My daughter's bum is happier for sure.

reviews.name: Samantha J.
reviews.title: Natural diapers that are really absorbent
reviews.review: My daughter has pretty sensitive skin but these diapers are amazing as they do not irritate her at all. Also they are really thin but super absorbent. She sleeps through the night and there was absolutely no leakage. I also love the wetness indicator which most diapers don’t have after size 2. I’m sold.

reviews.name: k phillips
reviews.title: Has not bothered my infants skin
reviews.review: Holds a surprising amount of pee for it not having the nasty chemical absorbent crystal things that other diapers have. These also have not irritated my daughters skin at all. We cloth diaper during the day and use these at night.

reviews.name: Ray Ray
reviews.title: So happy!
reviews.review: I’m so happy that Pampers has made a chlorine free diaper at last! It’s just like the swaddler diapers. It’s just not bleached. It doesn’t stick to my baby’s skin, it lasts just as long as the swaddler diapers and holds everything in very well. Doesn’t fall apart like other natural diapers. Five stars all the way!

reviews.name: Neely
reviews.title: Gentle for baby skin!
reviews.review: We have been Pampers users since day one with our baby and this new line of products gives us that extra feeling of joy knowing how gentle they are for his skin. We have been loving them and love knowing how great they are for our baby! Knowing something so gentle is going on the most gentle skin is such a relief!

reviews.name: Angela Martin
reviews.title: Great for babies with sensitive skin
reviews.review: Love that they are fragrance and lotion free and still provide the same great protection you expect from pampers. Having 4 children ages 18 months to 18 years, we have bought our fair share of pampers (only brand I use and trust) and by far these are the best ones they have created so far

reviews.name: erinfin
reviews.title: Don’t even consider another type of diaper!
reviews.review: After trying MANY brands, these are the ONLY ones we use. Love that they use sustainable materials, and the softness is absolutely noticeable. They don’t have the artificial scent and plasticyness of other brands.

reviews.name: Nikki M.
reviews.title: Super happy with these diapers
reviews.review: Super happy with these diapers. Very soft and absorbent. I love that they do not contain chlorine, fragrance, latex etc. have no trouble with leaks or fit. They don’t leave red marks or crease marks on my baby’s skin like a lot of other more natural diapers. The price point could be better but that’s my only complaint.

reviews.name: MommyAlpaca
reviews.title: Took away her rash!
reviews.review: We used many diaper brands. Babe has super sensitive skin so there was always an issue. These were great. Her rash went away as soon as we switched and they hold her mess great with no leaks. Cute designs and they fit well. Only complaint is the price. Over 60 cents for 1 diaper is nuts.

reviews.name: Valerie Leyva
reviews.title: Was looking for some diapers that didn't have as many ...
reviews.review: Was looking for some diapers that didn't have as many chemicals, especially since my daughter has very sensitive skin, and all other diapers have her a rash, including Honest Company. These don't have a weird smell, and we haven't had any problems with leaks. Just wish they came with more diapers for the price.

reviews.name: Anne
reviews.title: Get these worth it!!
reviews.review: I absolutely love these diapers I prefer this brand to MAJOR organic brands because of the absorbency while at the same time just not having a bunch of harmful chemicals that irritate babies skin.

reviews.name: Lizcart
reviews.title: Best disposables- great for sensitive skin
reviews.review: These are the best I have found. Tried all the organic ones but these are more absorbent- keep baby drier- and the wetness indicator is very helpful. I tried the Pampers Swaddlers but the scent irritated baby’s skin.

reviews.name: JK
reviews.title: Liked These Best - Great Absorbency, No Diaper Rash
reviews.review: We liked these the best after trying different kinds! Less diaper rash thanks to the mesh lining and great absorbency. Also really appreciate that these are fragrance free.

reviews.name: Jennifer
reviews.title: Good for Sensitive Parents and Baby
reviews.review: We are a fragrance-free house and very sensitive to perfumes and other chemicals. I love that these are "pure" and hold up just as good as any other diaper! I go up a size to use for nighttime diapers. No leaks! Thank you, Pampers, for making these!

reviews.name: Stephanie k.
reviews.title: Very soft and absorbent
reviews.review: I very much love these, very absorbent and doesn’t leak through to her clothes. Also cute little pictures on them . Also soft and fits well under her clothes not bulky

reviews.name: fitgirljules
reviews.title: Hands down best diapers
reviews.review: I have four children, and I can say that this is the best diaper I have ever used! It is the only one that does not have blowouts, and can last through the night

reviews.name: Kristan
reviews.title: So soft!
reviews.review: Love these diapers! The designs are so cute and stay up with the other diapers out there in competiveness . I love that they don’t have that typical diaper smell. No odor is fine by me. They will smell bad eventually anyways. Super soft and hardly any leaks

reviews.name: Melissa Zara
reviews.title: Super cute and unscented!
reviews.review: I ordered these for my newborn and love them! The prints are so cute and the lining is soft and doesn’t stick to my baby’s skin. I also love that they don’t smell like diapers. They hold up against leaks just as well as swaddlers too.

reviews.name: Zachary grotke
reviews.title: No leaks
reviews.review: I love pampers. I used them with my daughter and now I use them with my son. I have tried so many different brands and my son has leaked out of them all, but he has very rarely ever leaked out of pampers.

reviews.name: The Eyes Have It
reviews.title: Top Notch Pampers Pure!!
reviews.review:
I like Pampers Pure because it is free of harmful chemicals... just the thought of putting something with “harmful chemicals” on my baby’s bum persuaded me to buy these instead.

The price is right for a premium product.

I would like these even more if they were Organic but no harmful chemicals is a great start for me!!

Not to mention... excellent leak & “explosion” protection.

My baby was 10months and walking so finding a small enough diaper that moved with him without causing rash was an issue until I tried Pampers Pure... they are soft enough for babies on the move and still absorb everything without making them walk like Donald Duck.

Thank you Pampers Pure!!!

reviews.title: Great natural diaper!
reviews.review: Pampers new Pure (natural) line of diapers is very nice. They are soft to touch and fit my almost 2 year old better than the pampers dry fit line. I would say that for his age, weight, and liquid intake they aren’t as absorbent. Work great for daytime, but I wouldn’t recommend for overnight for his age. I am due in a few weeks with baby #4 and am very excited to use these! I think they will be perfect for a newborn-size 3 around the clock! The only thing I wish is that more diapers come in the pack. One more sleeve would be nice to be in line price wise and quantity wise with the rest of pampers line of diapers.

reviews.title: Do no break my sensitive baby out!
reviews.review: Okay these do not break my sensitive son out but they are also not my favorite simply because how rough they feel! But I still gave them 4 stars for fit, no bad smell, and not breaking my son out he has used honest since birth. Reason for trying is I like to help other moms out and if I see something that is suppose to be better I’m going to try and give a review that I think will be helpful I know honest are not always the easiest to get well I should say I have a hard time in the area I live in. I would buy these again.

reviews.name: Katlyn
reviews.title: Love the diapers, price not so much
reviews.review: I love these diapers! They are very soft and the wetness indicator is awesome! I love that the diapers are made with cotton and they have less ingredients than other diapers. In relation to Price however they are more expensive than I would like. Huggies little snugglers at $18 at the store for 80 and these were $24 for 74. Compared to other natural products these are comparable and very comfortable for baby. Unfortunately, My family has to save as much as we can and I cannot reason with $6 more dollars when Huggies Lil Snuggles are so soft and comfortable for my baby.

They're reliable, the ph strip works (some other brands, not so much), and they don't reek of chemical perfume. The Pure Wipes were too moist when her poop was very liquid, but now that we're introducing solids in her diet, I welcome anything that can help me clean the sticky mess. 4 stars only as this bundle sin't really the most cost-effective.

Love these diapers. So clean, so light, EG absorbent.

My one gripe is the box seems much bigger than the diapers inside. Almost like opening a bag of chips to find half the bag is empty.

Also, it really does add up when you start going through these diapers quickly. Sometimes I wonder if it’s worth it, because you can buy double the amount of Cruisers for the same price.

Glad these are not knock off Pampers like the Swaddlers I had on Subscribe and save.
