reviews.name: Allison Bergthold
reviews.title: Love this Pampers natural line!
reviews.review: We currently have one child in diapers (and three who've been potty-trained!) so we've tried just about every generic and name brand diaper over the years. We already love Pampers, and I really liked the idea of this bundled pack of baby-changing necessities: You get four of the pop-top packages of 56ct wipes (total of 224) and four 27ct packages of Size 3 diapers (total of 108!) I was intrigued by the "Pure" line, as we have been moving to more natural diaper options.. I like that these are fairly neutral colored print so they don't show under clothing: one design features two adorable otters, and the other design is an all-over milk-bottle print. The materials used for each competent of the diaper are clearly listed on the packaging, something I've never seen before! I really appreciate that this line is hypoallergenic, and without chlorine or bleach processing, latex, synthetic fragrances or lotions and without all 26 of the EU 26 Allergens. They are also thin (not bulky) but are very absorbent. My little one has sensitive skin and is prone to diaper rashes, but has not had any issues with these diapers. These actually fit my baby comfortably she is 25 lbs, even though she is at the top end of the recommended 16-28 lbs range. Also -- they still have the "wetness indicator" ! We use baby wipes for everything from standard diaper changes, to grimy/sticky hand cleaning, to theatre/dance make-up removal; and these Pure Protection wipes are great. They, too, are hypoallergenic, and free of phenoxyethonol, parabens, perfume, dye and alcohol. These have a very mild, barely-there, clean scent. These wipes have a nice weight to them, and are woven well with a very slight texture - they are actually really stretchy and very soft, like cloth. They are a good size and very durable. The wipes packet perfect for a purse or diaper bag, and the flip-top is nice - it is easy to remove just one wipe without pulling out the whole pack! My little one has sensitive skin and is prone to diaper rashes, but has not had any issues with these diapers or wipes. The price is a little high, but we will probably Subscribe & Save for convenience and quality of this line.

reviews.name: Gail Rodgers
reviews.title: Good pack size
reviews.review:
I got these for my granddaughter that is due in October, but it will be a while until she is the right size for them. I like the fact that they left out the things that babies skin can be sensitive to. The big thing for me was having 4 packs of diapers as well as 4 packs of wipes come all in the same box. Seems to be a very convenient way of getting them, instead of taking baby, buckling her into the car seat, get to the store and then unbuckling her to take her into the store just for a diaper run, when you can order them, and the mailperson will deliver them straight to your door. A convenience that is certainly worth it to many moms. I'm looking forward to seeing how they work out with my grandbaby.

Disposable diapers can really do a number on a baby's skin. I remember once that we were at a family get together and one of the moms had wandered off and left behind her baby who was getting increasingly fussy. We noticed his diaper was soaking wet and we changed it. That poor little guy had a bright red rash everywhere the diaper had touched, and it was drenched. When the mom came back she was mad that we had changed him into his very last diaper! If you can't afford to keep you little one in sufficient disposable diapers, then use cloth from the beginning. Over time they are so much cheaper than disposables. But just because a disposable can hold a lot of fluid, doesn't mean it should. Your babies skin is too delicate. Be sure you have sufficient diapers on hand always and change them as needed. Getting them in a pack like this help prevent the running out of diapers dilemma.

reviews.name: TheCatsMeow
reviews.title: Good at Preventing Leaks
reviews.review:
The Pampers Pure Protection diapers are reasonably favorable.

I got these for my little one and the sizing was correct. They aren't too bulky nor short or tight. The elastic clings but not in way that leaves marks. The rise in the front and the back is perfect for stopping any unwanted leaks and messes. Note that these do have a wetness indicator.

These are unscented which is important to us. We are sensitive to certain scents in our home so no weird perfumed diapers here!
My little one hasn't broken out at all when using these. I am pleased with no rashes, itching, or other skin irritations. I love they are made are made without chlorine bleaching, fragrance, lotion, parabens, and EU 26 allergens!

These are soft to the touch and can hold a good amount of wetness but I don't suggest using them overnight if you have a heavy wetter because it will seep a little if overly full.

These rest pretty slim under most clothes which is nice and don't break or detach when my little one is jumping, running and wiggling around. Recommended!

reviews.name: Samantha
reviews.title: Cute prints, we haven’t had any leaks.
reviews.review: I have to say I was very skeptical of these diapers in the beginning and honestly I hated them but over time they’ve grown on me. They are made a little larger than standard pampers, however there is no back elastic at all on the pampers pure so they still fit about the same. I honestly thought they wouldn’t hold anything but I’ve been surprised and we haven’t had any leaks yet, even with a newborn. The prints are super cute, and I’ve noticed that every size has different prints and they are all so adorable. They function great for us but I do think they are a little overpriced, however if you have a sensitive baby these are a great option.

reviews.name: Moises Garcia Landeros
reviews.title: They’re okay
reviews.review: We have a five-month-old daughter and have tried a bunch of diapers. Out of all the diapers we’ve tried, these are not in the top three. These diapers aren’t horrible but they do have a mesh lining that when it gets a little bit wet it comes apart and sticks to skin, which makes it a little less absorbent and comfortable for our daughter. I don’t mind using them because they’re good for sensitive skin and I haven’t had any leaks with my daughter, however they’re not my favorite.

reviews.name: RoMama
reviews.title: Cute design, clear ingredients, a good choice for more natural diapers
reviews.review:
First off, I'll state that I'm a pampers lover. Huggies always leaked or didn't fit right. We've been using Pampers swaddlers and cruisers for years (2 kids), but have tried almost every other diaper. I would say these are somewhat of a cross between honest diapers and pampers. They have a cute, subtle design and are hypoallergenic. The design does not easily show through clothing like other, bright designs. They have a great fit just like regular pampers. These do have the wetness indicator line like the swaddlers that honest and cruisers do not. They are also a lot softer than the honest or earth's best diapers! For absorbency, I would compare it more to the swaddlers. I prefer using cruisers for nighttime, heavy wetness.

If you do the math, I believe they are comparable to other sensitive/natural brands. If you are used to regular pampers prices, these are a little higher. I would say they are worth the price if you do subscribe and save to get more for your money. Very nice that you can get both diapers and wipes (in about the right amount too) in one order!

As far as the wipes go, these are nice. A lot like water wipes. But in my opinion, nothing beats the costco baby wipes!

reviews.name: brio
reviews.title: Good but overpriced
reviews.review: I love Pampers and these are good but they're expensive. They don't smell as nice either (which, is maybe a plus for some--I love the smell of whatever sweet baby something on Swaddlers). I was sick of Honest (they honestly aren't that great and they're expensive--constantly falling off my child or ripping, just not worth it) and thought we'd try these for a change. If you'd like a hypoallergenic diaper and don't mind the price these are good.

reviews.name: Anna Hope
reviews.title: Better numbers printed
reviews.review: I have been using pampers swaddlers for the most part on my two tinies since they were born. But who can say no to good diapers for free? So we gave these a shot. I have to say that I like them. They seem slightly roomier than the swaddlers but just as absorbent and comfortable without the chemicals which is important to me. If you have two kids in two different sized diapers though it could get very difficult to tell your diaper sizes apart as the number size isn’t very obvious and well printed. I do have to say we kind of missed our usual cartoons on the diapers but that’s not a big deal. I would definitely consider getting these again. They are very soft.

reviews.name: Michael
reviews.title: Great Diapers - OK Wipes
reviews.review:
This package came with diapers and wipes (would make a great baby shower present...).

I'm not sure exactly how these are supposed to differ from other Pampers diapers. The diapers are very similar to the Pampers Swadlers that we have used and love. We have had no issues with leaks or adsorption problems. These diapers seem a little lighter and softer than others, so we were initially skeptical. Overall, these diapers are great.

The wipes have no scent and the material is a soft woven material. I'm not a huge fan of these wipes. They are almost too soft to clean great. Bottom line, these wipes are good for wet diapers. If you have a poopie - might want to break out the Brillo Pad wipes - because these really take some scrubbing since they are so soft.

Our favorite and most unexpected like on these is that the diaper package have a handle on the top of them. It makes it nice to open the package and have a handle that you can carry it around with. I know this is small, but we like it. Makes it easier to get all the baby supplies when you have your hands full of baby.

reviews.name: Jess Maly
reviews.title: Love these but Expensive
reviews.review: Great diapers. Full coverage. No leaks. We tried these after my daughter was getting diaper rash but I don’t think it was bc of the diapers so we finally switched back to huggies. These are just too expensive to buy two boxes or more a month!

reviews.name: Kemgbr
reviews.title: Great natural option
reviews.review: I really like these diapers. When I first opened them, I didn't think I would because they appear thin and I was afraid we would have leaks, especially because I depend on using Pampers during the nighttime. However, although thinner, the protection seems to be the same as we have come to expect from this brand. I love the natural part, and expect/hope to see more natura options in the future. Our family has recently become very conscious of the products we use, checking the ewg website for things like shampoos, soaps, sunscreen, etc. I feel like I want to be extra cautious with my children, so a natural diaper is very much appreciated. I only took one star off because of the high price. We were very happy with these diapers though- no leaks, irritation, fit well.

reviews.name: Tech Expert
reviews.title: Works as expected!
reviews.review: My daughter is close to being potty trained so luckily I'm only dealing with little peeing accidents at this point. The diapers worked just fine for this. We're on a size 5/6. No issues with leaking. They appear to be comfortable, absorbent, and fit well. The designs are cute. I've also used the Pampers Swaddlers but don't really see the Pampers Pure being significantly better in quality. Both work great!

reviews.name: Mrs. Lac
reviews.title: Awesome product, sad about the price.
reviews.review: I love these Pampers Pure diapers and wipes. Love them! They are very soft, don't cause irritation and we haven't experienced and leaks or blowouts. My babe has sensitive skin so I have to be careful with his diaper brands- no rashes yet with the Pampers thankfully. It comes with enough diapers/wipes to last about a month. I do have to say that I go up one size at night though. Wipes are wonderful- soft, great snap-close packaging. They seem to slip out of the packaging much easier than with the other sensitive wipes I was using. So the one downfall is the cost of this product. Though I think it is awesome, there are definitely other brands out there with similar benefits that do not cost this much. I will continue to purchase these when I find them on sale/have a coupon, but won't be switching for the full list price.

reviews.name: WonFitMama
reviews.title: Pure are the best!
reviews.review:
I really like these diapers! Husband agrees! You are not sacrificing quality/absorbance by going natural. They're so soft and the protection was wonderful. The designs are cute too!
Wish they weren't so expensive!

reviews.name: Ashley Walden
reviews.title: Love These Diapers
reviews.review: Love These Diapers . Super Soft And Not Saggy Like Most Diapers Ive Tried . The Designs Are Super Cute . The Price Are Alittle Higher Than Most Average Diapers But Worth The Price .

reviews.name: Hayley Weston
reviews.title: Softer and kinder to skin
reviews.review: They fit nicely, were softer than other brands I normally use. Love the fact that their ingredients are more pure. So much better for babies skin

reviews.name: Cosmo-chan
reviews.title: Nice absorbent diapers but a bit pricey. Be sure to clip the coupon and use subscribe and save for much lower pricing.
reviews.review:
The Pampers Pure protection line is nice and is made with sustainable products. The core of the diaper is made from chlorine-free fluff pulp, mineral-based odor absorber and super absorbent polymer. The polymer absorbent lasts up to 12 hours and in our testing works very well.

There is a wetness indicator which reacts when urine touches the H-Sensitive Strip.

The diapers fit well and the wipes are alcohol, fragrance & parabens free.

You get 108 count diapers (Size 3) and 224 wipes split into 4 packages.

The whole package comes out to be a bit expensive if you are buying it as a one time purchase. My recommendation, join Amazon family to save 20% on diapers or use subscribe and save to save up to 15%. Also make sure to clip the coupon for a few dollars off as well.

reviews.name: Amanda L.
reviews.title: Diaper treasure find
reviews.review: I have a 4 month old and he is my 4th baby. I have tried pretty much every kind of diaper on the market (even cloth for a while) due to his sensitive skin. I always loved the pampers hold ability but hated the synthetic smell and contents. These Pure diapers are wonderful. I knew I would be impressed when I saw they offered a trial pack of three and a coupon at Target. Totally in love with these!

reviews.name: Bobby D
reviews.title: SOFT! And Absorbent!
reviews.review: These diapers were fantastically soft! We tend to value quantity over quality when purchasing diapers, but at the end of the day, we strive to ensure we are using a reliable, well made product. These diapers were great and hit all of our criteria, in deciding whether a diaper is a higher quality brand or product. They were very absorbent and did not leak at all. They are soft to the feel, and have caused zero irritation from use. Will definitely continue to use in the future!

reviews.name: Kelly Urban
reviews.title: No leaks, no smells and cute prints!
reviews.review:
I partnered with Pampers to review their new Pampers Pure Collection.
I've used various pampers products with my 2 daughters, and was happy for the chance to try their new pure collection diapers.
My first thought when opening the package was that they didn't smell as diapers sometimes do. They were soft and have adorable prints.
I like having the wetness indicator, although my daughter is 2 and at this age it isn't a huge priority.
I tried the diapers for various intervals throughout the day and even overnight. There were never any leaks of any sort. I also liked that they didn't leave red marks as I've had happen before.
These diapers are on the more expensive side, but you get what you pay for. I was impressed and would buy these again.

reviews.name: MES 214
reviews.title: I really liked these and they had great protection but I feel ...
reviews.review: I really liked these and they had great protection but I feel the quantity could be a little higher. Seems like we ran out fairly quickly and comparing the price to quantity, I would most likely purchase regular Pampers to have 20+ more.

reviews.name: CassieB
reviews.title: Great diaper, but the cost eh
reviews.review: The product itself is wonderful, my ONLY con really is the price. I just can't afford to diaper multiple babies/toddlers with the cost of these. But if I could, I 100% would!

reviews.name: John T. Horner
reviews.title: Pampers is trying to get into the eco friendly game
reviews.review: These are a slight variation on traditional Pampers with low fragrance and a few other minor detail changes. Green washing or eco friendly? That choice is yours to make.

reviews.name: Saur
reviews.title: ... come up with a healthier diaper because I really liked their brand but would not use them due to ...
reviews.review:
For a long time and kept saying I wish Pampers would come up with a healthier diaper because I really liked their brand but would not use them due to the chemicals. With that being said they're not as great as I hoped they would be. They are not very absorbent, and in no way would last 12 hours. After wearing them for one hour or less if I take them off after the baby has peed The inside is VERY wet and cannot be comfortable for the baby. They are not absorbent enough.
Andy Pandy is definitely better in absorption. However I feel Andy Pandy is stiffer than the pampers diapers. I may try them a little bit longer because I have a very gassy baby that needs to move around, but for overnight these will not last. Hopefully Pampers can improve this. I would also recommend them moving that mesh layer on the inside I really hate it.

reviews.name: Bridgette Ammons
reviews.title: Less diapers
reviews.review:
Says 35 in a pack
It was 32
Regardless, I kept them bc I needed them and it was only3 less

reviews.name: NJ Mom
reviews.title: Irritating
reviews.review: We’ve always used Pampers sensitive diapers but tried Pure this time around. The diapers live up to our expectations as far as fit, comfort, and containing messes. But our 2yo is experiencing so much redness, I can only think the Pure diapers aren’t absorbing as well as the sensitive diapers. The issue could my daughter’s skin and not the diaper, hence the two stars, but the fact she’s never ever had an issue in the Pampers sensitive diapers leads me to think this just isn’t a great option. A huge disappointment for how cute and promising these diapers were!

reviews.name: Kaitlin
reviews.title: Didn’t work well for us
reviews.review: We bought these when we ran out of our usual Honest company diapers. I was excited to try a non-fragranced pure version of pampers, but was disappointed in the product. They’re soft diapers and I like the wetness indicator strip, but the tabs aren’t stretchy (we had a few break off before we even got them on), and we’ve had multiple giant blow outs with these already, which is a problem we never have with Honest. I will definitely NOT be buying these again.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Strong Chemical Smell
reviews.review: So these are really soft diapers with cute patterns, but I will not be purchasing them again due to poor fit, and more than anything, a super horrible chemical smell every time she pees. The smell is faint before the diaper is used, but once she pees the chemical smell is very strong.

reviews.name: Marie
reviews.title: Caused rash/fit weird
reviews.review: We've used every diaper out on the market, including cheap store brand. Our favorite brand is usually pampers. But these particular ones don't fit like normal size 5. They cut into my daughter's hip/thigh really bad causing a rash. I think it's the way they are designed. They are also too thin, we won't be buying again.

reviews.name: CJ
reviews.title: No Bunny Print
reviews.review: I Purchased these diapers because they showed Bunnies on them ( as silly as that sounds) When I got them there was no bunnies.... very disappointed and I cannot return them now because I already opened them.

reviews.name: Kindle Customer
reviews.title: Bad batch
reviews.review: I normally love this deal, but our latest shipment had at least one full pack of diapers with defective sides where u tape diaper together. The tape was glued shut so you couldn't close the diaper. Had to throw them out. Totally waste:(

reviews.name: B Family
reviews.title: Chemical smell so bad you’ll get a headache
reviews.review: The bundle itself isn’t bad, I love the wipes! Now the diapers reeeeeeeek, there’s a weird chemical smell that gives me a headache... they work well but the the chemical smell has turned us off.

reviews.name: Stephanie
reviews.title: Chemical smell
reviews.review: I usually love this product and buy it at the store locally but decided to order off amazon this time and the product wreaked of chemical smells. Needless to say I threw them out and went to the store and bought new diapers.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Ripped sides... wasted diapers
reviews.review: It’s a good diaper that works but I’ve had so many of them rip on the sides even before putting it on baby and that is a big waste of money. Not sure if I wanna continue buying these for that reason.

reviews.name: Ashley Lieblong
reviews.title: Went back to baby dry.
reviews.review: Kiddo didn’t like them at all. Thought about switching from baby dry because I liked what I read about them but kiddo would fuss about her diaper minutes after going to the bathroom.

reviews.name: Juillet
reviews.title: Not what I expected
reviews.review: I really want to find diapers without the nasty stuff. Sadly, my daughter's blowouts leak through these. I had to switch to a different type of Pampers.

reviews.name: A R
reviews.title: Not worth the money
reviews.review: These run really big and do not fit well around the legs. I have given up on them. Too many blowouts and wet middle of the nights. Also very overpriced

reviews.name: Furious Orange
reviews.title: Pee outside the diaper
reviews.review: These diapers do not absorb and leak quite a bit. Bad even for store brand. Spend a little more and save yourself laundry.

reviews.name: Customer xyz
reviews.title: Defective tab
reviews.review: Roughly half of our diapers had the right tab sown in so we had to use tape. Not ideal. The diapers worked well otherwise

reviews.name: RikoShae
reviews.title: Cheaper diapers in this package
reviews.review: Get what you pay for. It's a great package but the diapers are cheaper than the usual pampers sensitive. They tear easily but if you're broke it'll work

reviews.name: EGerber
reviews.title: Not worth the cost difference to us. Aside from ...
reviews.review: Not worth the cost difference to us. Aside from new illustrations, I didn’t see much difference from our regular pampers.

reviews.name: HelenF
reviews.title: Poor absorbency
reviews.review: I’ve bought pampers swaddlers for each of my kids- and sensitive ones for the youngest two. I bought these because they too are hypoallergenic. Within 24 hours baby has a rash and they do not absorb nearly as well as swaddlers!

reviews.name: Sherry Z.
reviews.title: Stick with Swaddlers
reviews.review: I ended up returning these. My daughter has used swaddlers for 2+ years and I decided to try these. Bad idea... she got cuts on her hips from the diaper band and would get very red in her private area. Also these diapers left fuzzy residue on her private area.

reviews.name: Angelmommy
reviews.title: Compression leaks
reviews.review:
I was really excited to see a natural option from Pampers. I was planning to cloth diaper, but baby came a month early and my custom ordered diapers have not yet arrived. I had used swaddlers in the hospital with horrid diaper rash including blisters. I tried the sensitive Swaddlers with good results, but still rash. I found Pampers Premium care on clearance and they by far were the best we’ve used. Unfortunately neither the Premium Care nor the Swaddlers Sensitive are available.

I was excited to try the Pampers Pure and went to a few stores to find them. I find that the fit is decent and they are soft. Unfortunately, though, we have had horrible compression leaks when my daughter is in her car seat or napping. While I know she is a heavy wetter, we did not have this issue with the Swaddlers sensitive or the Premium care. Unfortunately, I will have to purchase another box of these to make it until our cloth diapers arrive.

reviews.name: JC
reviews.title: Disappointing, going back to Bambo Nature diapers
reviews.review:
I have used another diaper brand (Bambo Nature) for 9 years. I recently run out of my subscription and decided to go to Target for some diapers. I came across the Pampers Pure Protection and tried the size 4 on my 2 year old.
The Pampers is nowhere near as good as Bambo Nature. Like other reviewers have mentioned it doesn't hold wetness well. When my daughter pees it feels very wet on the surface unlike the Bambo diapers which absorb wetness very well and feel much drier on the surface next to my child's skin. It also sags and she often pulls at it because it makes her feel uncomfortable.
The Pampers costs as much as the Bambo (with Subscribe & save) so if the price is fine with you, I strongly advise that you try Bambo Nature instead.

reviews.name: Former Cashmere Resident
reviews.title: Seems big and leaks
reviews.review: I should state I received this as a sample, so I figured id give it a try. First off they seemed a little bigger than regular size 4 diapers. I dont know if it was because pampers runs a little bigger size wise than huggies, but they did not fit my little guy as great as his regular brand. I also felt that they smelled funny as soon as they became wet. Lastly when they were wet they leaked. The first time we used one was when we ran someplace and I had to change a wet kid and wipe out a carseat because of how bad they leaked. Could of been the size difference but I was not a fan of these and would not purchase these myself. I gave it two stars because they seemed very soft and gentle, so i did like that aspect of them.

reviews.name: KayDub
reviews.title: Not absorbent
reviews.review: I am really disappointed with these diapers. They are not at all absorbent compared to honest or seventh generation diapers. My baby literally cries out in pain as soon as he wets these diapers and he seems to be getting a diaper rash from them after 2 days of use. I will not buy again.

reviews.name: PK
reviews.title: Really wanted to like it... BUT
reviews.review:
Got these as a sample and really wanted to like them. However... I did not find it much different from Swaddlers other than it being softer. The lining got stuck on my baby’s bottom once the diaper got wet (this was just a pee diaper) both times. It ended up irritating the skin where the wet liner was stuck and caused a rash. Baby was in the diaper maybe 1-1.5 hrs. Also the inside of the diaper stayed extremely moist causing irritation to the groin area. For the extra $$ not worth it.

Stars are for the shape and size of the diapers which seemed roomier than the Swaddlers version of the same size. Function vise I’d stick to Swaddlers and if you want to be eco-friendly, I’d suggest looking at other brands.

reviews.name: kira
reviews.title: Not worth it.
reviews.review: The only diaper I’ve tried that can’t contain no. 2. Every blow out we’ve had has been in this diaper. While it’s “more natural” I don’t think it compares to honest and certainly not baby dry or even swaddlers. cute prints though. Sizing runs a bit big as well vs. other size 1s

reviews.name: Matthews
reviews.title: Rotting wood smell
reviews.review: These diapers smell awful. Absolutely awful. It's bad enough when they are dry, but worse when wet. It's like a mixture of chemical and rotting wood. I left 2 stars because they work fine otherwise.

reviews.name: KO
reviews.title: They aren't very absorbent
reviews.review: I'm shocked by all the great reviews. I hate these diapers. My daughter feels damp and squishy every time she pees even a little in this diaper, I had the same problem with Pampers Cruisers. I noticed that with my niece as well, but wanted to give these a try on my daughter. I like the wipes, but we will be sticking with Honest and Seventh Generation.

reviews.name: eliane greiman
reviews.title: Not the real pampers pure
reviews.review: These are fake pampers pure. I always buy them from Target and after comparing them, there are definitely not the same diapers. Didn’t give a rash to my baby super sensitive bottoms though
